column35:
Create new dedicated topic for DWH events in eda application and a dedicated listener on Mulesoft.

This has impact on both central and GR integration. This CR is related only with central integration

[~mczarnecki] please for your feedback / effort

CC [~amitkou] [~edimaki] [~george.menikidis]
column178: the solution should guarantee the immediate processing of day to day events since this sync process is critical for our business. The sync should not take more than some seconds since any delay causes productivity issues and delays to our business.
column319:
Separate kafka listener will be introduced with ability to configure:
 * topic subscription pattern
 * number of consumers

This new listener will poll kafka broker independently and will follow simplified flow*

 

*Simplified flow will be based on same logic for retry (retriable/non retrial errors), dl/error-notification topic for failed events, but the part related to locking master id will be removed.

 

Assumptions:
 * new flow will use separate and dedicated Kafka and sf configuration
 * new user with masterVersion validation disabled will be created in sf
 * new topic definitions will be delivered

 

Flow description:
 # Read event, parse
 # Process (try to upsert subset of fields - described as status fields by Michalis)
 ## success - flow finished
 ## failure - send event to dedicated retry topic and go to point 1 for reprocessing (if error is retriable) incrementing retry counter. On retry exhausted, send event to dedicated error/dl topic
column382:
14/Jun/21 1:20 PM;mgiannat;The new topics are:

*customerSynchRequestTopicNatCo**Dwh* (UAT/PROD) 

 *customerSynchRequestTopicNatCo**Dwh_**sit* (SIT)

And the relevant error topics are *customerSynchRequestTopicNatCo**Dwh_**err*  (UAT/PROD)

*customerSynchRequestTopicNatCo**Dwh_**sit_**err* (SIT).
column383: 18/Jun/21 9:54 AM;mczarnecki;[~Gabor.Fal], [~mgiannat]  are You ok with solution design?
column384: 18/Jun/21 4:25 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~mczarnecki] I am wondering about consumer configuration. How do we scale? What worries me here is that on DWH topic there will be lots of events but only every once in a while so there should be normally only few consumers but should be scaled up when actual load happens. What if we have like 4-6 consumers there running idle or somehow have it as a property to be able to scale up without deployment? Or start / stop flow thru REST API or config change with fixed amount of consumers.
column385:
18/Jun/21 5:16 PM;mczarnecki;[~Gabor.Fal] idling consumers are not taking much of resources - but of course it would be good to control the process manually (depending which takes more resources, idling consumers or REST API itself).

We can either scale up by changing config file or by deploying additional worker (which I would prefer).

Unfortunately We can't change consumer number without restart.
column386: 18/Jun/21 5:18 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~mczarnecki] thank. So would the DWH side have like 4-6 consumers idling mostly in order to avoid problems and if really necessary start extra worker or have like half the number of partitions and start extra worker if needed?
column387:
18/Jun/21 5:26 PM;mczarnecki;[~Gabor.Fal]: I do not know the exact number of partitions on DWH topic, so it is really hard to answer.

It would be good to have results on DWH mass update for UAT env before answering, but taking into consideration synthetic test results and assuming that DWH topic has 6 partitions, I would start with:

6 consumers on input (less then four consumers alone takes 20% of cpu under load on synthetic test)

6 consumers on DWH

1-2 consumers on retry
column388: 23/Jun/21 11:20 AM;Gabor.Fal;[~mczarnecki] There will be test happening soon on performance. But I would rather go with like number of partitions / 2 for the DWH listener. This way when DWH load is coming and seems to be going slow another worker can be spun up and later shut down without problem. What do you think?
column389: 24/Jun/21 11:49 AM;amitkou;[~Gabor.Fal] we will confirm solution after test is complete [~ipasialis] [~edimaki]
column390: 28/Jun/21 10:17 AM;mgiannat;Hello [~mczarnecki] [~Gabor.Fal], do you expect any feedback from our side here?
column391:
29/Jun/21 1:38 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~mgiannat] I just would like to make sure that potential risks are well understood. 
 * When big number of events are coming from DWH on one topic and same records can still be updated thru existing topic there might be failures on the DWH update due to timestamp inconsistencies. 
 ** For example:
 *** Record A is getting update thru DWH update - timestamp is 1234 - event is added to the topic. With current performance it will be processed in about 30 minutes
 *** Record A is opened and edited in UCM before it is getting processed and upserted to SalesForce, updated record is sent to the customersync topic with a new timestamp 1250 that is higher than 1234. 
 *** Since the same record has two version on two different topics and DWH topic has a lot of events to process while normal topic has only normal amount of events normal topic update will make it to Salesforce faster than event from DWH topic. 
 *** Due to SalesForce side timestamp validation (only newer records are accepted) DWH topic update will be rejected. Rejected event will go to error topic. Error topic should be monitored and records that ended up there with invalid timestamp should be sent with a correct timestamp later. 

 

To mitigate above risk DWH upload can take place when there is little or no other traffic. Also records part of the DWH can be locked in UCM for editing for the time being until batch is processed (this actually pretty much solves the problem).
 * Second risk is what Maciej have mentioned that if DWH update event is getting retried for some reason it will block processing of same record coming during the retry window.

Mitigation is the same for the above.  Outcome here is different, in case of the first risk you will get an event on Error topic which you will need to replay with new timestamp. In case of second you get a user experience that processing is slower (instead of 3-5 seconds full e2e round trip from SF to UCM and back on Prod as seen yesterday it will be minutes (if lot of retries are there can be many minutes).
column392:
29/Jun/21 2:00 PM;mgiannat;Thank you, to avoid this “timestamp” issue please override the timestamp in DWH events during the consumption in Mulesoft.

With this trick this risk is solved for sure right? At any case we would like to avoid failures just for the timestamp of DWH events.

 

About the second risk ok but this is also an existing risk even with the current implementation.

 

At any case the solution should guarantee the immediate processing of day to day events since this sync process is critical for our business. The sync should not take more than some seconds since any delay causes productivity issues and delays to our business.

 

Finally, no there is no logic in UCM for handling timestamps.

 

[~wnowosad] [~oana.ene] could you please share target date?
column393:
01/Jul/21 2:38 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~mgiannat]

Taking the timestamp verification out is additional change on SalesForce side, plus in that case also possibly on MuleSoft to be able distinguish DWH update events from normal events. It should be possible I think but needs additional effort for sure, but I would leave this to Deloitte to estimate.

 

Currently as you have seen sync from UCM to SalesForce is on average finished in one second assuming there is no lag on the normal sync topic (if no retry or technical failures on either side), to keep this up and make sure DWH update flow is fully isolated  without the risks mentioned in the solution design / my emails I believe also additional analysis would be needed as this specific sync time requirement is new.

[~wnowosad] Can you please align with tema to estimate?

column404:
19/Oct/21 12:11 AM;mczarnecki;[~mgiannat]:

from functional perspective, the logic is almost ready for:
 * skipping master id lock logic
 * upserting data using dedicated user with master version validation turned off

However, to be 100% sure, I would like to know the scope of changes that can be sent from DWH, especially:
 * what type of events can be sent from DWH
 * are there any additional needs in terms of data mapping for upset operation on DWH events

As of now, DWH flow is using exactly the same mapping as normal event - this may lead to data from normal channel being overwritten. If I remember correctly, you have mentioned, that for DWH flow there will be only few status fields sent for one particular event type. Could you please enlist which fields are supposed to be updated by DWH?

 

Kind Regards,

Maciej
column406:
19/Oct/21 1:36 PM;mczarnecki;Hi [~mgiannat],

I agree that consistency should be kept - as discussed in the past, to achieve that -  data scope from normal flow and dwh flow needs to be different (fields modified by dwh should never be modified by normal flow and vice versa -  to avoid race conditions).

I would like to remind, that we have also agreed, that since version is not validated, same event will never occur more than once in same batch (otherwise we can encounter race conditions between different updates of same event).

Do I understand right, that DWH flow:
 * will only modify accounts?
 * will only modify fields mentioned in your previous comment (which are account plannings, status and creditProfiles in the scope mentioned above)?

Please let me know so I can proceed with alpha tests and adjustments.
column407: 19/Oct/21 3:20 PM;mgiannat;Hi Maciej let's keep it simple on Mulesoft. Please just extend the existing event and only the DWH related fields will be taken into consideration from Mulesoft since only those will be send from GR in the specific topic
column408:
20/Oct/21 11:01 AM;mczarnecki;[~mgiannat] , [~Gabor.Fal] :

I believe we can't do it in a simple manner -in my opinion there are some complications.

e.g.:

If we are talking about account sync - then there is a delta calculation, meaning, that if for example account team members are not sent, then the delta will result in dropping existing ones. I believe that this is not a behaviour that we are expecting.

The same will occur for each event that is processed by delta calculations.

 

My suggestion is to:
 * describe what type of events are to be sent in dwh channel ([~mgiannat])
 * analyse potential impact and eventually implement conditions for delta ([~mczarnecki])

Regards,

Maciej
column409:
20/Oct/21 11:06 AM;mgiannat;Hi Maciej, not clear what do you mean. We are talking about upsert operations here. Upsert normally does not drop existing data. Please note that the events will be the same that are currently send but just in different topic.

if needed please set up a short call tomorrow
column410:
20/Oct/21 11:30 AM;mczarnecki;For regular fields this is exactly how it works (meaning field not sent -> update does not take place).

However there are special fields which are calculated based on delta, like team members on accounts or line items on opportunity.

Delta works in a way, that mule first query sf for existing records and then compares it with payload sent from legacy.

Records not existing in payload will be removed from salesforce, records not existing on sf will be added.

If you need further clarifications, please let me know about your availability.

Regards,

Maciej
column411:
20/Oct/21 11:35 AM;mgiannat;if you need any clarifications from my side please set up a call tomorrow between 10.00 - 12.00 GR time.

Thanks

Initial timeout should be set to 30 seconds end to end
column316: There is a need to increase timeout on the 360 view to x seconds. We need to have configuration based on which we can control this behavior.
column319:
We need to implement: 
1. Custom Setting field in the coredt__GlobalSettings__c to called '360 Timeout'. It will be storing value in miliseconds. Field Type should be Integer
2. 360 View controller which fetch '360 Timeout' and use this in the logic.
Logic:
a) when value '360 Timeout' is empty We don't change default timeout in the 360 View Controller
b) when value '360 Timeout' is not empty We overwrite default timeout in the 360 View Controller
3. Apex script 'GlobalSettings.apex' should indicate in the GR package '360 Timeout' field value to '30 000' (30 seconds).

column1: Decision Maker flag = True by default on TS Console
column35:
*Decision flag checked by default on TS Console*

The Decision flag on TS Console must be TRUE by default , and the user must be able to set it to false if needed
column178:
When using Telesales application and creating a new query, the Decision Maker flag needs to be set to True by default. 

The user should be able to set it to False. 

If user wants to change the query by clicking on "search again" after clicking on "search", the Decision Maker flag needs to be the same as set before by the user

column1: GR - first name and fax validations
column35:
*Contact First name as mandatory*

Have contact First name as mandatory when a user creates or updates a contact from New contact tab , account ,  lead conversion process , TS console (currently we have *sync problems* due to the fact that the users create new contacts with blank First name)

 

*No validation on Fax filed* 

Remove phone validation from field “Fax” in all objects / forms
column178:
When Contact is created from a new Contact form or from Lead conversion, the First Name must be mandatory. If First Name is not provided the following message is displayed: "Please provide contact first name to continue"

There is no validation of Fax number on Account
column316: First Name needs to be mandatory and Fax number should not have validations in order to facilitate integration with legacy
column319:
# There is a need to switch off validation on the Fax number on the Account, to make it please implement in the core package additional bypass specific only to this validation.
 # Newly introduced bypass should be marked for all GR profiles to bypass Fax validation
 # New Validation rule should be created to verify if Fist Name on the Contact is provided
column382:
01/Jun/21 12:35 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi]  [~ELeodi]  [~oana.ene]

this is a new US created from the email sent today by Filio (there is also a request for making decision maker mandatory, but I will create a separate story for it). 

I would like to clarify some points:
 # on Contact it is not possible to mark this red asterisk * next to First Name. We can make it mandatory with a validation rule, which means when user creates Contact they will not see it's mandatory, but when they will try to save they will get an error message. I hope this is ok.
 # should we make the First Name mandatory on Lead as well? Same situation as for Contact, we cannot put the red mark on the layout that first name is mandatory, otherwise they will hit the validation at the moment of conversion and they will need to start the conversion again, which is annoying
column383:
01/Jun/21 12:53 PM;ELeodi;hi [~jkomorowska]
 # we are ok with this
 # first name should be mandatory only when creating a new contact through lead conversion (like contact role) .could we also have this field in Lead conversion mandatory fields in lead form?

!image-2021-06-01-12-52-41-820.png!

cc: [~tkiritsi] , [~oana.ene]
column384: 02/Jun/21 1:50 PM;jkomorowska;[~ELeodi] I don't understand your comment for Leads. We can make First Name mandatory on Leads at creation (same rule apply as for contacts - there will be no asterisk visible on the screen) or they will hit the validation on Contact when do the conversion. There is no option to make the first name mandatory just before converting
column385:
03/Jun/21 10:59 AM;ELeodi;Hi [~jkomorowska]
 # we are ok with no red asterisk as long as there is the following indicative error message " please provide contact first name to continue"
 # what we are asking is an already existing functionality that you have provided for contact and account creation through lead conversion

on lead form on the right hand side there is a summary form with all mandatory fields needed for contact and account creation through lead conversion.

so when user tries to create a new contact through lead conversion, he should see the error massage for mandatory fields and go back to lead form, fill them all in on right hand side field and continue.

so in fields below contact first name should be added

!image-2021-06-03-10-56-59-282.png!

cc: [~tkiritsi] , [~ipasialis]
column386:
07/Jun/21 12:23 PM;jkomorowska;[~ELeodi] ah, ok, I understand now. It is not possible to add "First Name" as a field there. First Name, Middle Name and Last name are parts of the field "Name" and are only visible when you edit. We can only add "Name" to the list of fields you mention, but I'm not sure if that's helpful, because if user populates only Last Name, he will see the "Name" field is not empty so will not understand he needs to provide First Name as well .

So do we want to make First Name mandatory on creation of the Lead?
column387:
08/Jun/21 9:51 AM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c. [~ELeodi]

Ok since its not possible to add this field there , we don't want  to have it mandatory on the lead form either , so lets proseede with the validation rule on create contact through lead conversion exactly as described on the acceptance criteria ,with an indicative error message ""Please provide contact first name to continue"

column1: leads with wrong lead channel export in Siebel

on siebel prod, you should export leads and fix lead channel where it is wrong

on leads tab all leads accross organization and select "Query"



!image-2021-05-18-16-24-37-612.png!

then you set the following query fields

!image-2021-05-18-16-27-03-383.png!

then you press go and when results appear from menu you select export

!image-2021-05-18-16-33-19-569.png!

on excel file you will filter by Lead partner shop = blank

!image-2021-05-18-16-35-31-133.png!

and what you will get is the leads that should have lead channel cosmote

!image-2021-05-18-16-36-47-145.png!

then you must do the same for opportunities

in all opportunities across organization you run the same query and the query fields are as shown below.

then export the results and do the same in the excel

column1: Ability to search  on the TS console with Follow up date = null
column35: As a TS agent I need to be able to search account on the TS console by setting the Follow up date field to NULL (now I can only set a range of dates).
column316: Dummy Call Lists
column319:
CustomerSearch component:
Add checkbox "Empty" in Follow-up section.
When checkbox is checked
 * Disable follow-up range fields
 * Remove FollowUpDateFrom and FollowUpDateTo from filterCriteria
 * Add  FollowUpDate to filterCriteria, value:null, same field, operator OP_EQ same relationship same date

When checkbox is unchecked:
 * Enable follow-up range fields
 * Add FollowUpDateFrom and FollowUpDateTo to filterCriteria
 * Remove FollowUpDate from filterCriteria,

++Report should show following information:+ +
|Zip Code|Total Count of  Customers|Total Calls |unique customers communicated|# of Active customers|# of Terminated customers|# of Potential customers |
|105 64|100|130|50|10|15|25
  |

**Columns should be grouped by Account Zip Code. 

 

Total Count of Customers - Total number of accounts 

Unique customer communicated - accounts that have at least one response of active customers, # of terminated customers. # of potential customers are based on the Status (Account) - Existed, Once Existed, Never Existed  

 

It should be possible to filter report based on the following parameters:

Customer segment (total , or set of values)
 Class of account (total , or set of values)
 Potential value (range , > , <)
 Create date of Response (from /… to )

column1: Customer Segment picklist values for Account - CR
column35:
In all legacy systems value for Customer Segment is TBD-BUSINESS and in SF is TBD – BUSINESS. 

Customer Segment Picklist needs to be updated with TBD-BUSINESS in order to be aligned with legacy systems values.
column319:
* Change picklist value from TBD - BUSINESS to TBD-BUSINESS  on Customer Segment field on Account and on Segment field on Public Account
 * Update the value on reports (AccountFollowUpDate, CompetitorProductsView), where it is used as filter criteria
 * Update the value on Account Record Types

column1: Create Lead - Existing Customer / Multiple Instances
column35:
1. Log in Siebel with a SHOP user that satisfies the given eligibility rules.
2. Go to myCosmoView Home Page and press the Create Lead button next to the search bar.
3. Insert the TAX# of the customer you wish to create lead for.
4. The customer has multiple accounts. Select one of them and press Proceed to Lead.
5. You will be navigated to the Create Lead screen. Customer info will be prepopulated and read-only. Fill all the mandatory fields with the repsective info.
6. Create the Lead

1. Log in Siebel with a SHOP user that satisfies the given eligibility rules.
2. Go to myCosmoView Home Page and press the Create Lead button next to the search bar.
3. Insert the TAX# of the customer you wish to create lead for.
4. The customer has only one account. Select it and press Procced to Lead.
5. You will be navigated to the Create Lead screen. Customer info will be prepopulated and read-only. Fill all the mandatory fields with the repsective info.
6. Create the Lead
1. In the Create Lead Screen select the drop down list AREAS OF INTEREST.
1. Navigate with a SHOP User in the Create Lead view for a customer.

column35:
1)  A shop user logs in that is able to navigate to user dashboard. 
2) The user presses the User Dashboard icon on the right section of myCOSMOView. 
3) He is navigated to User Dashboard where the Leads Tile is visible. 
4) The user presses on the Open Leads. 
5) A list with the Open leads is displayed. 
6) The user presses the button: View All

1)  A shop user logs in that is able to navigate to user dashboard. 
2) The user presses the User Dashboard icon on the right section of myCOSMOView. 
3) He is navigated to User Dashboard where the Leads Tile is visible. 
4) The user presses on the Open Leads. 
5) A list with the Open leads is displayed. 
6) The user presses on a specific lead in order to display further information.

1)  A shop user logs in that is able to navigate to user dashboard.

3) He is navigated to User Dashboard where the Leads Tile is visible. 
4) The user presses the + icon

1) Login with a user that is able to navigate to user dashboard. 
2) The user presses the User Dashboard icon on the right section of myCOSMOView. 
3) He is navigated to User Dashboard where the Leads Tile is visible. 
4) The user presses the 3 dots icon. 
5) A selection is displayed: View All. 
6) The user selects: View All

column35: * Add MigrationId field to Call List Item object (255, external, unique)

[^Harmonized Product Levels.xls]

In Greece in order to enhance reporting, different - local Product Level 1, Product Level 2 is needed. These are additional attributes that should be available on a local level. 

"Local" Product levels values available on Product object: 

  !image-2021-03-25-10-32-46-287.png!

 

Values from newly created fields should be synchronized OUT and available for reporting. 

The naming could be GR Product Family (Level 2) & GR Product Area (Level 1) .

The GR values must me the ones visible on the U.I. (the HQ fields must be hidden)

Users  must be able to see / create reports on both.
column178:
* Fields  GR Product Family (Level 2) & GR Product Area (Level 1)  are visible on product level and add new product to opportunity screen
 * GR Product Family (Level 2) & GR Product Area (Level 1) are available for reporting 
 * New fields are available in HQ reporting
column316: As a User I want to be able to properly report on the products so that my reporting classification is compatible with local rules.
column382:
25/Mar/21 1:17 PM;kwojtczak;Hello [~tkiritsi] , 

I would like to confirm some information or ask additional questions related to the user story above. 
 * To confirm: we want to have a new  - "local" product 1 and product 2 structure that will be mostly used for reporting. 
 * The information should' be available for integration. 
 * New structure should be available on Products (Product2) object. 
 * On the UI user will be still able to choose harmonized values on following objects:
 ** Leads
 ** Account Opportunity Product
 ** Opportunity Competitor 
 * New fields do not need mapping, but should be available for admins when adding new product. 

 

Additionally, we need to think about the name of the fields. 

 

 

cc: [~oana.ene] [~ipasialis] [~mtzouma]
column383:
25/Mar/21 1:44 PM;oana.ene;One clarification:
 # The product Level 1 and 2 is already implemented and available in Greece - these are the old values which will be:
 ## seen in the UI
 ## reported on by Natco
 # Product level 1 and 2 New, harmonized for all Natcos

 
|2nd Level|1st Level New|
|Mobile Revenues|Mobile Service Revenues|
|Mobile Device Revenues|
|Other Mobile Revenues|
|Fixed-line Revenues |Fixed-line Service Revenues |
|Fixed-line Device Revenues|
|Other Fixed-line Revenues|
|DataCom_Traditional|ICT|
|DataCom_FIA|
|DataCom_SD-WAN|
|SysSol_Digi-Infra_Networking|
|SysSol_Digi-Infra_Security|
|SysSol_Digi-Infra_Collaborat|
|SysSol_Digi-Infra_IT Devices|
|SysSol_DC&Privat Cloud|
|SysSol_SaaS|
|SysSol_DCS-Public Cloud|
|SysSol_SysInt_Smart City|
|SysSol_SysInt_IOT|
|SysSol_SysInt_SW Integration|
|SysSol_SysInt_SW Develop|

 
 New Product level will have to:
 # Sync back to the HQ org, based on new L1 and L2 the HQ reporting will be done
 # L1 and L2 new will have to be mapped by the greek team to the current 3rd level products
 # Greek team should be able to report on new L1 and L2 too.

 

[~tkiritsi] - I think I've captured everything, right?
column384:
26/Mar/21 11:57 AM;ipasialis;Yes [~oana.ene] you got it right

 

[~tkiritsi]
column385:
30/Mar/21 6:01 PM;oana.ene;[~kwojtczak] - this story needs to be estimated.

[~tkiritsi] - when do you expect to have this?
column386:
30/Mar/21 6:07 PM;tkiritsi;[~kwojtczak]

c.c [~oana.ene] [~ipasialis]

Please do your best so we can have it  before the onboarding of the next100 users on 10/5 ( *definitely before* the onboarding of the next 200 users on 31/05)

In the meantime the 15 power users that are already live ,have the directive to use only the old values (even they see all of them) but we expect DLT to deactivate the reporting values as soon as possible in one of the next packages in order to avoid mixed data. Is that possible ?
column387:
30/Mar/21 6:13 PM;oana.ene;I don't think it's possible. The story needs to actually be implemented in order for the users to see only one set of data.

[~kwojtczak] - we need to look at this one with priority.
column388:
30/Mar/21 7:04 PM;kwojtczak;[~oana.ene] [~tkiritsi]

Just to confirm, local Product Levels will be only available on the Product2, right?
column389:
30/Mar/21 7:34 PM;tkiritsi;[~kwojtczak]

C.C. [~oana.ene]

local Product Level 1&  Product Level 2 is needed
column390: 30/Mar/21 7:36 PM;oana.ene;Is there any issue if we use the same Product Level 1 for both local and HQ? The only difference is that in the name of fixed and mobile we have revenues. It will simplify a bit the number of fields. [~tkiritsi]
column391:
31/Mar/21 10:18 AM;tkiritsi;[~oana.ene]

c.c. [~kwojtczak]

There is no major difference between these 2 fields (Level 1 local vs Level 1 HQ), however i think to keep them separate it would be a more clean cut solution , especially for reporting reasons .Of course i am no expert on reporting . Maybe Krzysztof can advise us on that .Moreover i cannot predict if in the future there will be a local business need to differentiate level 1 local from HQ since the whole point of this user story is to decouple the two hierarchies .
column392:
01/Apr/21 9:58 AM;kwojtczak;[~tkiritsi]

I would say its more up to business requirements - from reporting perspective we can show in reports all fields from data model.  If for now Level 1 hierarchy is the same on both - NatCo and Harmonized side, then there is no point in creating two fields with the same information. Also it gives a higher effort to maintain it. But if you see that this classification can change in near future and will have other values then two fields are needed.
column393: 02/Apr/21 4:45 PM;kwojtczak;[~tkiritsi] how should product level fields on local side named?
column394:
02/Apr/21 5:27 PM;tkiritsi;[~kwojtczak]

c.c.[~oana.ene] [~ipasialis] [~ELeodi]

I aligned with Sales and we decided to go with specific local field for Level 1 too.

The naming could be GR Product Family (Level 2) & GR Product Area (Level 1) .

The GR values must me the ones visible on the U.I. (the HQ fields must be hidden)

Users  must be able to see / create reports on both.

column391:
07/May/21 12:31 PM;ampoura;Hello [~jwszolkowski] , [~mreznyk]
Regarding the post deployment step “Creating Reporting Snapshot”   in the Running User Field  I can put only one user for each snapshot , although  we want  2 users to be the “running”  in each  snapshot. How can we proceed with this ?  
Best Regards, 
Boura
CC [~tkiritsi] [~ipasialis]
column392:
10/May/21 10:22 AM;jwszolkowski;Hi [~ampoura],

It’s okay, one reporting snapshot contains only one running user. That’s why in manual step it’s specified to create 2 separate reporting snapshot to cover 2 users.

Kind regards,

Kuba
column393:
10/May/21 12:52 PM;ampoura;[~tkiritsi] [~jwszolkowski] 

There are 2 supervisors responsible for the COREX agents team & 2  supervisors responsible for the DIRECT  agents team.
The members of the team don’t get this report , so there is no need to schedule it that way.
What we need is for **either one  of the supervisors of each team to be able to run this report **.
Is that possible ?
column394:
10/May/21 2:48 PM;jwszolkowski;[~ampoura], [~tkiritsi], [~kwojtczak]

To sum up - access to those 2 reports will have everybody with access to the folder. Supervisors anytime can go there and see actual reports. 

In terms of reporting snapshots, the running user determines data that are part of the snapshot. It will be automatically run in the context of this user in the scheduled time. The crucial aspect here is the assumption that 2 supervisor from the same team has access to the same data. If so, there should not be a difference between snapshots regardless of which of these users will be running users. 

If there are records owned directly by one supervisor, they won't be visible by the other (I assumed that's not shared), but it not looks like a valid business case - please correct me if I'm wrong. 

My proposition is to create one reporting snapshot per team and mail it to 2 supervisors or create reporting snapshot for each supervisor separately and mail it to him/her.

 * In the modal that is raised the user presses the Create button.
 * The user is navigated to the Create Lead View.

column1: Create Lead - Existing Customer / Multiple Instances
column35:
1. Log in Siebel with a SHOP user that satisfies the given eligibility rules.
2.  Go to myCosmoView Home Page and press the Create Lead button next to the search bar.
3. Insert the TAX# of the customer you wish to create lead for.
4. The customer has multiple accounts. Select one of them and press Proceed to Lead.
5. You will be navigated to the Create Lead screen. Customer info will  be prepopulated and read-only. Fill all the mandatory fields with the repsective info.
6. Create the Lead

1. Log in Siebel with a CC User  that satisfies the given eligibility rules.
2.  Go to myCosmoView Home Page and press the Create Lead button next to the search bar.
3. Insert the TAX# of the customer you wish to create lead for.
4. Press Cancel Button
column316: Create Lead - Navigation

column35:
1. Log in Siebel with a CC User  that satisfies the given eligibility rules.
2.  Go to myCosmoView Home Page and press the Create Lead button next to the search bar.
3. Insert the TAX# of the customer you wish to create lead for.
4. The customer does not exist in Siebel.Select Proceed to Lead.
5. You will be navigated to the Create Lead screen. Customer info will not be prepopulated. Fill all the mandatory fields with the repsective info.
6. Create the Lead
column316: Create Lead - Non existing customer

column35:
1. Log in Siebel with a SHOP user that  satisfies the given eligibility rules.
2.  Go to myCosmoView Home Page and press the Create Lead button next to the search bar.
3. Insert the TAX# of the customer you wish to create lead for.
4. The customer has only one account. Select it and press Procced to Lead.
5. You will be navigated to the Create Lead screen. Customer info will be prepopulated and read-only. Fill all the mandatory fields with the repsective info.
6. Create the Lead
column316: Create Lead - Existing Customer

column35:
In Shop Dashboard in the Leads tile press the "Three Dots" icon.
He selects the View All option from the drop down list.

column1: CLONE - Account and Contact Phone Number fields customizations (GR)
column35: Due to the phone number format in Greece, in order to keep data consistency, a set of validation rules is needed.  Currently implemented validation rules related to phone numbers should be deactivated and removed.
column178:
* Validation rule for Mobile field on Contact and Lead is working according to criteria: Stars with 69 and have 10 digits 
 * Validation rule for Phone, Other Phone fields on Account, Contact and Lead is working according to criteria: Starts with 69 or 2 and have 10 digits
 * Field "Foreign Phone" with no validation is created on harmonized level and visible on GR layouts on Account, Contact, Lead
column316: As a Salesforce user I need to be able to store phone numbers in a structured and controllable manner.
column319:
* Validation rule that fields start with 69 and have 10 digits.  Applies to: Mobile field on object: Contact, Lead
 * Validation rule that field starts with 69 or 2 and have 10 digits. Applies to Phone and Other Phone fields on Account, Contact, Lead 
 * Removing current validation rules related to numbers on Account, Contact, Lead 
 * Additional field "Foreign phone" with no validations visible on Account, Contact, Lead

Report Name: Events per Agent and AM

Report Folder: 'Tele-appointement Reports'  

 

Report type: Summary Report

Group rows: Created By, Assigned, Event Reason 

Add summary formula: "% of Event Reason": 
 * Formula output: Percent, 2 decimal points
 * General: 
 RowCount/PARENTGROUPVAL(RowCount,CREATED_BY)
 Display:
 *Where should this formula be applied?*: Specific Groups, *Row groups:* Event Reason

 

Row Counts: TRUE

Subtotals: TRUE

Grand Total: TRUE

Stacked Summaries: FALSE

 

Filters:

Created Date:

column389:
25/May/21 9:37 PM;tkiritsi;[~jwszolkowski]

The "Show me" filter covers the need , there is no need for Creator role on that report .

column382:
02/Mar/21 3:48 PM;kwojtczak;[~tkiritsi] in order to start development of the reports - i am creating separate user stories per report. 

In this US  I have one more question -  Creator's user role - can we have Opportunity Owner role filter instead? It will show only Opportunities where Opportunity Owner has role related to Tele-Appointements. It is faster to implement that way as we do not need to add additional report type.  I think that with this filter we should meet requirement.
column383:
02/Mar/21 4:13 PM;tkiritsi;[~kwojtczak]

You should not use Opp.owner , instead of Opp. creator beacouse then you would end up with no results ! The TS agents are never the opp. owners ,they always create opp. that they assigns to Account managers that belong to a different profile .

If integration tires to create an Account without Name it will fail. [~jwszolkowski] can you remind me please - are there validations on the Account creation for those fields? And if yes, are they bypassed by integration user?
column388:
10/Mar/21 12:21 PM;jwszolkowski;To sum up:
 * Validations for VatId maintained how it used to be -> it's required on layout level and there's validation to meet GR-specific format, bypassed by Integration
 * Validations for Phone and Industry Occupation Description -> it's required on layout level. Industry Occupation Type and Industry are read only, as they are copied from Industry Occupation Description relation
 * Validations for Address -> those are implemented via validation rule, as it's not possible to make it required on layout. Validation is bypassed by Integration User.
column389:
10/Mar/21 12:32 PM;ipasialis;hi [~jwszolkowski] , 

The option you mention  ( only creation validation or both creation and update ) is available only in Address?  Or it applies to other mandatory fields in the US ?

cc [~tkiritsi] , [~mtzouma]
column390: 10/Mar/21 12:36 PM;jwszolkowski;This option is availabe each time when we implementing validation with Validation Rule or custom code logic. If we are making field required only on layout level, then it's automatically applied to creation and update. In this case I implemented it only for Address field, as it wasn't possible to make it required on standard layout.

column394: 11/Mar/21 9:34 PM;jkomorowska;[~ipasialis] I don't understand. So address should be required when Account is created but then after creation it can be deleted?
column395:
12/Mar/21 9:32 AM;ipasialis;Hi [~jkomorowska] , 

in the previous comment [~jwszolkowski] said that it is possible for us , because of the way that was implemented. The reason we made this decision is that we realized that there are already many customers in Salesforce that do not actually have address. So in order not be blocking for the user ( about the past empty addresses)  , we agreed to apply the validation rule only upon creation. Of course , as you noticed, this gives a side way to bypass the validation ( first you fill address and afterwards you can delete it) , but we prefer to do it this way

 

Hope this answers your question

 

[~tkiritsi], [~ethanopoulou],[~eanagnostou]

For R2 Go Live:  access from outside trusted IPs must be allowed only with the addition of 2factor authentication (provided by Salesforce). 

For R3: Access from mobile Salesforce applications (IOS, Android) will be allowed only using our local Mobile Device Management solution. We are currently using VMware AirWatch.
column178:
Regardless of device used (mobile or desktop) 2FA is required when outside of IP ranges:
 * If Ip Address is in the ‘trusted list’ it will log you in with Login, Password or SSO.
 * If IP Address is not in the ‘trusted list’ You will be asked during login to register ‘application’ and provide a code.

These scenarios are the same for any user except Data Integration Profile

Below is the range of the Trusted IPs for the 2FA:

195.167.52.129 - 195.167.52.254

212.205.50.65 - 212.205.50.94

212.205.39.113 - 212.205.39.126

column35:
As a Salesforce tele-appointments user I want to have migrated data from Siebel to Salesforce, for Siebel Responses (= Salesforce Call List Items). Especially for Responses with Type = "ΝΑ ΓΙΝΕΙ ΝΕΑ ΚΛΗΣΗ" that are still pending the actual callback to be done, apart from the response I also want to have the respective call back tasks in Salesforce with Call Back date set to Siebel "Call Me Back Date". (= Salesforce Call Back Task)

 

The Responses information we want to have available in Salesforce are (see attached Siebel Responses List, Siebel Response Details):
 * Created on: the date that the record was created in Siebel
 * Created by: in case the user exists in Salesforce it should be populated with the respective username, else it should be populated with the username of the user performing the migration
 * Response type: the response type
 * Summary: the summary
 * Call Me Back Date: this field is date/time and we need this information for Responses with type "ΝΑ ΓΙΝΕΙ ΝΕΑ ΚΛΗΣΗ".

 

We need to have historical data since 2017 (~2.000.000 calls; ~500.000/year)

 * *CreatedDate*

 * Id
 * IsDeleted - 'false'

 * LastModifiedDate- not supported

 * Order__c - not supported (default in SF = 0)
 * *ResponseType__c -* Response Type

column388:
01/Mar/21 5:13 PM;tmichalislis;[~ethanopoulou], [~tkiritsi] you state:

_As a Salesforce tele-appointments user I want to have migrated data from Siebel to Salesforce, for Siebel Responses (= Salesforce Call List Items). Especially for Responses with Type = "ΝΑ ΓΙΝΕΙ ΝΕΑ ΚΛΗΣΗ" that are still pending the actual callback to be done, apart from the response I also want to have the respective call back tasks in Salesforce with Call Back date set to Siebel "Call Me Back Date". (= Salesforce Call Back Task)_

"Call Me Back Date" is not a Siebel Mobile Response field. It is information set on the Account named "Follow Up Date". This info is presented in Responses through a join and it is not stored in the Campaign Response. This field was migrated from legacy at the Account level.

What will be the purpose of this field in Salesforce. Will it continue to work as it works now in legacy or a specific field will exist in the Tele-appointments entity to store this date and we will re-migrate this information there also?

And one more question: Campaign Responses are associated with:
 # Campaigns
 # Offers
 # Treatments
 # Accounts
 # Contacts

We only see the link to the Account entity. We do not need any information from the other entities to be migrated?

+Call List Item field mapping:+
 * Account__c - ExternalAccountId must be provided
 * *CallBackId__c -* *used for Call Backs only; the Id of the Call Back Task*
 * *CallDate__c - Created on*
 * CallList__c - *TBD*
 * *Comments__c - Summary*
 * Contact__c - Contact ExternalId must be provided
 * CreatedById
 * CreatedDate
 * CurrencyIsoCode  - not supported defaulted to DataMigration user settings
 * Id
 * IsDeleted - 'false'
 * LastModifiedById - not supported
 * LastModifiedDate- not supported
 * Order__c - not supported (default in SF = 0)
 * ResponseType__c - Response Type

In case Siebel Response Type is "ΝΑ ΓΙΝΕΙ ΝΕΑ ΚΛΗΣΗ" and the actual callback is still pending to be done, apart from the Call List Item the Callback task is also needed.

+Task field mapping:+
 * Subject - 'Call'
 * Type - 'Call'
 * CallBackDate__c - Call Me Back Date
 * ActivityDate - The date part of the "Call Me Back Date"
 * WhatId - ExternalAccountId
 * WhoId - Contact ExternalId
 * CallItem__c - the related call list item Id
 * IsCallBack__c - 'true'

column35:
If an Account has no open Leads and no open Opportunities in the last 6 months – the Account needs to be anonymized:
 a. A set of fields will be anonymized, the anonymization is to be done in legacy and pushed to Salesforce
 c. In case there is a field that needs to be anonymized on the Account, the same field will be anonymized in all relevant objects – GR team needs to check the list of field
 * Not editable by anyone
 * Not valid for adding/editing on leads/opportunities/tasks/events/Teleappointment
 * We must be able to report on past lead/opps this account had in the past
 * Not participating in the synchronization process
column178:
# An Account cannot be anonymized if it has an open Lead -  the Account field on Lead marks the association of Lead and Account, the Status of Lead is NOT Closed-Converted or Closed-Not Converted
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if it has an open Opportunity connected - Stage field is NOT Closed-won or Closed -Lost
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if in the pas 6 months there was a Lead or Opportunity created for that Account
 # There is a new field on Account HasNoOpenLeadOpp, not accessible to users, that confirms if the anonymization can be done based on above criteria (if HasNoOpenLeadOpp = FALSE  the Account cannot be anonymized)
 # HasOpenLeadOpp value change is sent to legacy
 # After account is anonymized it should not be possible to edit it
 # After account is anonymized it is not valid for adding/editing on leads/opportunities/tasks/events/Teleappointment
 # Anonymized account should not by synced with legacy
column319:
New field checkbox HasNoOpenLeadOpp available only for integration, direction OUT

Automation to check/uncheck this checkbox: 
 * if an Account has an open Opportunity or an open Lead the Account HasNoOpenLeadOpp = FALSE
 * The HasNoOpenLeadOpp field is marked TRUE if there was no Lead or Opportunity created in the last 6 months
 * Change of the HasNoOpenLeadOpp triggers update of Account in Legacy system

-New checkbox field Anonymized, sync IN, not visibble not available to users except admin and data integration-

Validation that anonymized Account cannot be edited

New read-only page layout, record type, without buttons on layout and without buttons on related lists, automation to change record type when the status of Account is changed to "anonymized". 

Validation that anonymized Account cannot be added on the creation of Lead, Opportunity

Automation to set field IsDelisted__c = TRUE when status = "anonymized"

column385:
04/Feb/21 4:43 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi]

I'm thinking about what is an "open lead" or "open opportunity" in the last 6 months.

Should we only concentrate on the opportunities that were closed-lost and Leads that were closed-not converted? Let's say it's 31. December today, the last Opportunity was created for an Account on 1. June and it was closed-lost on 1. August. Can this Account be anonymized? Should we base the 6 months on "created date" or on "closed date"?
column386:
04/Feb/21 6:53 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c. [~ipasialis]

Open leads are  those that are in status other than rejected & converted 

Open opportunities are those that are in status other than closed -won & closed lost

If today is 31/12 and there is an anonymization request coming from our legacy , then SF (or integration i dont know excacly) must check if in SF there are any open leads & opps that their creation date was beetween 01/6-31/12

- if the check results to YES then the anonymization must NOT be done in SF

-if the check results to NO then the anonymization must be done in SF
column387: 05/Feb/21 11:09 AM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi] every lead or opportunity was open after creation. So if we only check the creation date, then it doesn't matter if it was closed or is still open. In short, if any lead or opp was created during last 6 months we should not allow anonymization, right?
column388:
05/Feb/21 7:17 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

C.C.[~ipasialis]

Joanna its good that you insist on this clarification , thank you for that !

I checked with Sales again & DPO and in order to cover all cases (mostly big ICT & key accounts projects that may be open for a very long period of time) ,we must do the following :

Anonymize the account that has a related  lead or an opportunity , unless the lead /oppor. has creation date in the past 6 months (regardles of status) or is still open* (regardless of its creation date) 

open*= as defined in the above comment
column389:
05/Feb/21 8:12 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi]  [~ipasialis] ok, I think we got it now. Please confirm:
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if it has an open Lead -  the Account field on Lead marks the association of Lead and Account, the Status of Lead is NOT Closed-Converted or Closed-Not Converted
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if it has an open Opportunity connected - Stage field is NOT Closed-won or Closed -Lost
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if in the pas 6 months there was a Lead or Opportunity created for that Account
 # There is a new field on Account HasOpenLeadOpp, not accessible to users, that confirms if the anonymization can be done based on above criteria (if HasOpenLeadOpp = TRUE the Account cannot be anonymized)
 # HasOpenLeadOpp value change is sent to legacy

 * We must be able to report on past lead/opps this account had in the past
 * Not participating in the synchronization process

Especially for the last one, from our Legacy point of view , we will not sent again any updates for this account and we must not receive either( all synch keys and related records will be deleted in our legacy).

 

[~jkomorowska], [~oana.ene], [~tkiritsi], [~eanagnostou], [~amitkou]
column397:
19/Feb/21 4:54 PM;jkomorowska;[~ipasialis]  [~tkiritsi]

I have added your last comment to the US, please note this means additional days to deliver this story.

Please verify the Acceptance Criteria now:
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if it has an open Lead -  the Account field on Lead marks the association of Lead and Account, the Status of Lead is NOT Closed-Converted or Closed-Not Converted
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if it has an open Opportunity connected - Stage field is NOT Closed-won or Closed -Lost
 # An Account cannot be anonymized if in the pas 6 months there was a Lead or Opportunity created for that Account
 # There is a new field on Account HasOpenLeadOpp, not accessible to users, that confirms if the anonymization can be done based on above criteria (if HasOpenLeadOpp = TRUE the Account cannot be anonymized)
 # HasOpenLeadOpp value change is sent to legacy
 # After account is anonymized it should not be possible to edit it
 # After account is anonymized it is not valid for adding/editing on leads/opportunities/tasks/events/Teleappointment
 # Anonymized account should not by synced with legacy

 

Also additional information will need tobe provided from legacy, that this Account is anonymised - ca we agree we will add a field "Anonymized" on the account as checkbox, that will be sent as "TRUE" with message from legacy with anonymized data?

 

FYI [~amitkou]  [~oana.ene]

column404:
22/Apr/21 8:03 PM;milipinski;[~ipasialis] 
It is not possible for the end user to accomplish that in some cases. 
Let's say user is creating an account from the new opportunity screen. 
They click +new account option in the account lookup, provide necessary data, click save => account is created
Lookup on the opportunity creation is filled in with the created account, but an account created in the system is already without any opportunity and lead => it could be marked for anonymization.

I would propose to keep those childless accounts for some period of time before making them for anonymization(few days for instance).

Also I'm thinking about implementing this feature with Salesforce Batch feature that can be scheduled to run periodically (daily if possible and needed). I hope it is fine for you to, have an account without any activity in last 6 months marked for an anonymization with some delay. 

This solution won't affect daily performance of the system as we would calculate the flag only once a day (probably during the night) and not during the "save" record action.  And will be easier to accomplish this way as well. 

Let me know if its fine for you

Can you please check how many account records we have in production right now and provide some estimates for the future as Id like to test the performance of the job to estimate minimal time span between them?

column407:
23/Apr/21 3:41 PM;milipinski;Hi  [~ethanopoulou] 

This type of field HAS TO have default value so we're safe here. I will set it up to true (as it won't trigger anonimization). 

There is a possible edge case that might occur:
1. Account is created on Monday 4 55 pm, but the user do not proceed with the Opportunity creation as it s end of the day.

2. Batch to mark accounts for anonimization runs durring the night

3. Unfortunately it is a night of legacy anonimization job as well - Account is anonimized in legacy and update is sent to Salesforce

4. User cannot find the Account as data is anonimized to create the opportunity. 

I just want to confirm that this scenario is not a problem

 

If we exclude Accounts from anonimization for 7 days after the creation, even if there is no opportunity nor lead, we should be safe (or less confusing to the end user at least)

column413:
05/May/21 1:57 PM;milipinski;Hi [~ethanopoulou] 
Unfortunately we have to use reversed logic on the field.
The reason for that is that we might break the integration with the current solution. 
If we use *HasOpenLeadOpp* (true-do not anonimize, false can be anonimized) default value on the old records will be false as we said before. 
Because of that we will have to have a job that recalculates value for all records as we do not want to anonimize it. 
During the recalculation we will trigger integration for all accounts (500k records) and it will trigger platform events for all of those. Unfortunately this will consume limits for the platform events hence it's not recommended. 

Because of that I reversed logic on SF side. The field is named *HasNoOpenLeadOpp* (true - anonimized, false - do not anonimize). Default value on the new and old records will be false - we wont trigger anonimization for any record.
Daily job will only check records that have no opportunities and leads (I can query exactly those accounts) and it will limit number of updated records. This allows us to limit the impact on the integration with the first run of the job.

FYI [~ipasialis] [~amitkou]

This story adds a priority rule to USSFA-3047

We must add response "Lead"in prio 3 of the 3^rd^ rule (after Opportunity) and move the rest down by one.
So the new priority rules should look like this:

Business requirement:
- criteria to sort the query are given on system level
1. Call back (if on the same user)
2. Date of last communication with the contact (the older communication the higher on the list, based on Date)
3. Response on Campaigns (based on Priority of the Account response)
4. Number of attempts to call the client (less attempts - higher on the list)

Regarding 3. Response on Campaigns (based on Priority of the Lead response) the responses are prioritized as following (so the third priority rule contains the followin prioritizarion)
1.Call Back (it comes above all when the time of the call back comes)
2.Opportunity
*3. Lead*
4.Pending contact
5.Call again
6.Voice mail/fax
7.Mapping for Future Sale
8. Not interested at the moment
9. Event
10. Competitors/other providers
11. Member of group of companies
12. Not profit organization
13. Negative response

column1: Decision Maker flag value is not published to SF properly
column35:
This US results from a bug raised, that Decision Maker flag was not correctly handled in SF when sent from legacy. The reason is that in legacy there are 3 values of this field, when in SF UI there are only 2 values, as it is a checkbox field. It has been decided after a call on 12.01 that in legacy this will change and NULL values will not be an option there anymore going forward, all the records with NULL values will be changed to TRUE.

In SF the default value of the Decision Maker field for GR needs to be TRUE, user should be able to change it if needed.

========================================

You will find the original bug description below for reverence:


We identified that for the following Account Info, which was created at Siebel Mobile the decision maker flag was not published properly, thus the Account was not reached at SF:

CONJURING

Vat 091310069

Tax office ΑΜΦΙΣΣΑΣ

Phone 2101313133

Occupation Descr: Κινηματογρ. Ραδιοτηλ. Παραγωγή

Sfa address ΚΑΡΑΙΣΚΑΚΗ 15 zip 153 41

Sfa contact: ΦΑΡΜΙΓΚΑ ΒΕΡΑ phone 2311000000

Row id:
|1-AF39136| |
|ΕΔΡΑ: ΒΑΛΤΙΝΟΝ 120 zip 421 00
 Legal: ΠΑΤΡΙΚ ΓΟΥΙΛΣΟΝ phone 2106622330
  |
column319:
Field _Decision Maker_  for Greece should be set to TRUE by default. 

Definition of the field to be moved on local repository level.
column382:
18/Dec/20 1:14 PM;egourdoumpa;Hello [~gkagkas],

as we could not see Account CONJURING at SF yesterday, we raised Jira issue #4335, in which there is a comment that _the value of field "value" under "characteristics" where "name" : "desicionMaker" seems to be empty String but we expect either no value or "true"/"false"_.
And for that reason Mulesoft's transformation failed and the event was not sent to SF.

However, we investigated thoroughly from our side and we concluded that we do send the information to SF, as expected.

In brevity, this is the expected format for null values. 
Thus, it is important for you to treat this field as null, when you receive it in this format.

Could you please check from your side and let us when the change will be ready, to re-test it?

Thank you
column383:
21/Dec/20 9:05 AM;amitkou;[~pdlugosz]

[~mtzouma]please provide del date
column384:
21/Dec/20 2:12 PM;gkagkas;We get "true" or "false" as value and provide them as boolean to SF.

 

If we get something else, like empty string this means MS assumes that there is a value so it tries to match it with the appropriate value (true or false).

Casting empty string, or other strings/numbers etc in MS will need custom code.


Also, SF always assumes a value for boolean (even if MS do not send value).

So, empty string is not appropriate value, it should always be "true", "false" or not sent value at all so MS won't map it and it won't change to SF (it will keep the previous one if this is update or it will have the default value on creation).
column385:
21/Dec/20 2:41 PM;tmichalislis;This is the only boolean field in SF that is used for the GR NatCO. I will not discuss how or who decided that this field should be boolean since it is not boolean in any of the legacy environments. It is a pick list that can have Yes / No / - / NULL.

All the null fields are send to all the systems as empty strings. This is the way the legacy infrastructure operates. It is not possible to change this for this specific field.

There is the option to change the field type in SF from Boolean to pick list values or process it in Mulesoft with code as you suggested.

Can you please proceed with one of the proposed options?
column386: 21/Dec/20 2:47 PM;tmichalislis; Michalis, can you please review the issue and decide on the next steps?
column387: 28/Dec/20 9:28 AM;amitkou;[~mgiannat]:: Hi Mihali, please see above
column388:
07/Jan/21 10:07 AM;mgiannat;Good Morning and Happy new Year,

This field should be updated in SF/Mulesoft side in order to support "empty/null" value as well.

So the supported values should be:
 # Yes
 # No
 # <empty string>

So instead of boolean this should be *picklist in UI*

Thank you

column35:
There are 4 components for Greece:
 # Active assets (products that the customer is having which are active on the current contract)
 # Bills
 # Interactions
 # Service request
 ## Mobile
 ## Fixed
column178:
3. Interactions

The Interactions component must present interactions within *last 90 days*

No filtering, no sorting

Fields and description:
|Created|created date|
|Created by|created by who|
|Creator Group|the group the creator belongs to|
|System From|the source system of the interaction|
|Interaction Id|interaction's identifier in source system|
|Option|this must be a free text from what I can understand|
|Type|email/fax/inbound call/internal (only this types of interactions)|
|Area|all areas of selected types|
|Sub-Area|all areas of selected types|
|Description|Description|
|Category|all categories|
|IVR Division|Technical Corp/Sales|
|TT Phone number|Number/asset of interest|

 Note: Any sorting will be in the definition of GR NatCo local integration e.g. by Created Date

 

 

List view related to this component should include following fields:
 * Interaction Id 
 * Category
 * TT Phone Number
 * Area
 * Sub-Area
 * Option
 * Created

 

Detail view should include fields mentioned in list view + all other fields mentioned in the table above.

16/Mar/21 10:50 AM;mreznyk;Hello [~ipasialis]

Just like we did with Service Requests component, we need to confirm which fields should be in list view (table containing the list of interactions) and detail view (modal that appears when you click "Open" button, next to a specific record from the table in list view, to view details of a specific interaction). Example of that UI with screenshots, you could see in latest comments from Joanna in https://jira.dtoneapp.telekom.net/browse/USSFA-4176

 

In list view, we should have up to 6-7 fields that describe the record the best and have a relatively short value, so the UI don't get too crumpled. For example field like "Description" is an obvious candidate to be put in detail view, instead of having it in list view.

Giving that, do you think this set of fields could be included in list view: Interaction Id, Area, Sub-Area, Category, Created. All other fields (including those from list view), will be put in detail view.

If you think the different set of fields should be present in list view, please give it to us.   

Thank you in advance!

column1: Submit response in case no Contact on Account - CR
column35:
There are some Accounts for which there are no Contacts attached. When user is presented with such an Account he should still be able to submit a response.
 # In case the user makes the call and someone picks up, the user should be able to create a Contact (preferably directly from the TeleSales app). In such a case, any response should be available for this contact/account. Additional button on related contacts list added (in order to refresh the list).
 # In case the user makes a call and there is no answer or someone picks up and refuses to give any personal data, the Contact cannot be created. In such a case, the user should not be able to select call back, opportunity, lead or event response
column178:
Given Telesales user is in the Teleappointment App and has already prepared a list of accounts to call before, when an Account is presented for which there is no Contact, the Telesales agent should till be able to record a response.
 # User is able to create a Contact 
 # After Contact is created, user is able to select any response linked to that Contact
 # User can create a response without creating a Contact, in that case user cannot select call back, opportunity, lead or event as response
column316: As a tele-appointments agent I want to be able to submit a response even when there is no Contact assigned to this Accoount
column319:
* in teleApp's CurrentAccount component
 ** added button for refreshing related list of contacts
 ** added 'New' button for creating a new contact
 * in teleApp's CurrentCallItem component
 ** changed child component layout structure so that teleApp's Response Handler component is always displayed

column383: 02/Dec/20 6:59 PM;jkomorowska;[~ELeodi]  in this case, there is a gap in the user story 2607. The story says, that only if Contact is created by user in SF and not by integration/migration it should be editable, it has nothing to do with the role of the Contact. [~tkiritsi] can you help in defining which Contacts should be editable, if this is not the right criteria?
column384:
02/Dec/20 9:00 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c.[~ELeodi] [~mtzouma] [~aanagnostopoulos] [~ipasialis]

The reason for having this gap in 2607 is because the original need was to:
 * have the “Legal Representative” Contacts managed by Siebel and synced to SFDC as read-only Contacts (through Integration user)
 * and on the other hand, to have the “SFA Sales” Contacts being created on Salesforce (by the end-users) but not synced to Siebel 

So far so good. Discussing this approach with Gabor though, he had valid objections about the dual mastership of Contacts (“Legal” in Siebel and “SFA” in SFDC), so we all agreed to sync all Contacts between the two systems. And that is the root cause of this gap.

 

So, due to that change, the actual need has changed a bit;

Regardless of which user created each Contact, either Integration user or End-user, *Salesforce users should NOT be able to create /edit /delete Contacts having the “Legal Representative” role*.

 Users in Salesforce *MUST  be able to create, manage, and sync to Siebel, all other Contact Roles* e.g. SFA Sales, COE, Procurement, etc. providing the required flexibility.

This is a requirement *absolutely critical for our Go live on 7/12* , because thousands of SFA Contacts will be migrated in SF , and after go live the power users switched to SF MUST be able to edit them in SF .

*Please help asap !!!!*

KW

column35:
After meeting on 17.12.2020 it was decided to use an iFrame to display assets.

We decided that we need a Salesforce View that will present to the user an iframe with a customer asset view , locally implemented , reflecting the specific business needs of these customers.

The content of the iframe will be based primarily on discussions that have already taken place and it is our Natco responsibility to deliver it.

For cases when user’s OneLogin (ADFS Integration using OneMail SSO credentials) *access_token* (not an app token) and the *id_token* used for the resource server session _have both expired_, then +the user will be prompted to login into ADFS inside the iFrame+. This will not effect Salesforce because a separate token is being used after retrieving an id token which has lasts longer than the one generated by ADFS.

Datapower endpoints for WebApp:
 * SIT: [https://pagsit.ote.gr:577/assetView/\{externalAccountId}|https://pagsit.ote.gr:577/assetView/%7BexternalAccountId%7D]
 * UAT: [https://paguat.ote.gr:5577/assetView/\{externalAccountId}|https://paguat.ote.gr:5577/assetView/%7BexternalAccountId%7D]
 * PROD: [https://pag.ote.gr:577/assetView/\{externalAccountId}|https://pag.ote.gr:577/assetView/%7BexternalAccountId%7D]

 # On report " Events per agent & A.M." we need to capture events that are only related to Accounted accounts , therefore we can either use Unaccounted flag = false , or use Account division other than Null

*Answer:* OK 

        2. The respective permision set will be given (by our admin) to the users that belong to the following specific roles :Tele-appointment Manager , Supervisor TS Lead Qualification Team  , Supervisor TS Outbound CorEx Team,Supervisor TS Outbound Direct Team so that they can edit the reports.

*Answer:* Yes, the permission should be *"Manage Reports"
*         
         3*.* All users that have TS profile must have access to the respective folder/s (do they all have to have the respective permission set as well?? i think not)

*Answer:* They should be able to read reports without additional permissions. The only thing is to give appropriate permission when its needed to edit reports.


           4. I would like to have 2 distinct sub-folders a) TS Direct Reports b)TS CorEx Reports .Those 10 reports must be cloned - the only difference must be the user role they refer to .For the TS Direct Reports , all of them refer to the users that belong to the TS Outbound Direct Team Agent role . For the TS CorEx Reports , all of them refer to the users that belong to the TS Outbound CorEx Team Agent 

*Answer:* Can we do one folder: TeleAppointements Reports so that all TeleAppointement users would get access there?  When it comes to the data that will be displayed, so it will be based on the access to which records particular user have access (role hierarchy).  What do you think about it?

With report folders we are managing access to reports- so we manage what set of users can see reports included in the report. 

So in this case we could choose sharing of the report with DT Read Only Role and Roles and Subordinates of Tele-appointement Manager. So the visibility would be to the users who have role marked in yellow below:

!image-2021-03-02-18-23-06-312.png!

 

 

When it comes to what user see in the report - he will see the data to which he has access to (based on role hierarchy and sharing concept already implemented in the system).

12/May/21 4:02 PM;jwszolkowski;Meeting notes from today's call. [~tkiritsi], could you take a look at highlighted points and confirm them before I will implement them? 

Visibility concern
 * Business Admin and supervisors access to Dashboard/Report folder should be fixed with USSFA-5739 and *to be tested by DT.*

 

Yearly calls per agent + reporting snapshot (USSFA-4953)
 * Consideration about access to Calls Per Agent Snapshot object in terms of Teleappointment User – to be checked if proper Teleappointment Users have access to it. Only supervisors should access those records
 * There is a problem with this reporting snapshot*.* Running users does not have permission to edit target object – this error message occurred when tried to set specific users as Running User in Reporting snapshot. To be checked if it would affect supervisors and if so to investigate how to address it
 * Running User considerations – it’s okay that one of the users will be the Running User. Second user may be added to the mail list and get reporting snapshot as well.
 * Tips for testing
 ** Initially schedule it to run daily to create records and send mails on daily basis
 ** Check out if content of records is what’s expected

 

Account follow up date (USSFA-4968)
 * Narrow down columns to Account Name , VAT , Account Owner , Account Division , Customer Segment , Status

 

Opportunity per Agent and AM Report (USSFA-4770)
 * Add columns to include Opportunity Name , Opportunity Identifier , Account Name , VAT
 * Use Created Date filter instead of Close Date

 

Competitor Products View (USSFA-4973)
 * Filter All Accounts instead of My Accounts
 * Unaccounted → include both True and False → Adding filter logic
 ** *By default it should be true or false or both → to be decided by DT*
 * *Follow up Date → Adding filter logic and relative date equals '' – to be decided by DT*
 * *Potential Total Value → Potential Adding filter logic and equals '' – to be decided by DT*
 * Narrowing columns down to Account Name , VAT , Account Owner , Account Division

 

Accounts with competitor FUD (USSFA-4969)
 * Potential Total Value → Potential Adding filter logic and equals ''
 ** *By default it should be equals or more than 0 OR equal null → to be decided by DT*
 * Detail rows consideration → *define extra columns here by DT*
 * It refers to each account → without filtering for Teleappointments Accounts – that’s valid and nothing to be changed

  

Lead Dashboard (USSFA-5009)  
 * Lead Funnel is accessible in Lead Reports folder – it’s okay, nothing to be changed

  

Events per Agent and AM Report (USSFA-4774)
 * Covering scenario to filter for Creator Role
 ** Idea → Create a supporting field for reporting purposes which will be populated with creator role → to be verified
 * Unaccounted filter to be added → Unaccounted false
 ** Idea *-* OR new Record Type need to be created
 ** Another idea *-* supporting field on Event to store information if parent account is accounted
 ** Assumption which is confirmed: we working on Events which are related Accounts
 * Created Date & Date consideration: one is when it was created, second when it occurred, nothing to be changed

  

Agent Monthly View (USSFA-4965)
 * Dashboard is the end goal
 * Grouped by agent and month
 * Challenges to be identified and dealt with
 ** Opportunities are not related directly with Call List Items
 ** Discussion to be continued on next meeting
 * In general to move on dashboard proposition need to be created and proposed

column1: Verify if Validation rules on Opportunity are turned on (GR)
column178:
The following automation/validations are present in the system, turned off by default. Some should  be switched on

IsAccountAlreadySynchronized - USSFA-373 Account is not yet synchronized, StageName=Proposal, Account.IsDirty__c = true *NO*
IsAccountOwner- USSFA-796 To change the Opportunity Owner, you need to be Owner of the related Account. *NO* 
IsClosed.validationRule - USSFA-366 You can't modify record after Closed Stage if Bypass integration is not set *YES*
IsLostReasonFilled - USSFA-366 You need to fill Lost Reason before selecting "Closed - Lost" stage. *YES*
IsMovingForwardInStage -USSFA-373 You can't choose any Opportunity Stage which is before your currently selected one on the Sales Path *NO*
IsMultiChannel - If Opportunity is Multichannel you must select Category and Sales Channel - *NO*
IsOppLockedFromProposalStage - USSFA-362 / USSFA-1221 / USSFA-1030 You can't change Opportunity after entering Proposal stage. *NO*

column1: Filtering SFA Address Postal Code in Query for customers - CR
column316:
As a Tele-appointment Agent, in the query that I build in order to search for specific clients, I need to be able to filter SFA Address Postal Code in my my Query by including or excluding certain values and/or ranges. For example:
	• search for specific zip codes (e.g. 16552 OR  15127 OR 14121)
	• search through ranges ( e.g. >=10440 AND <=10447,  <=10440 OR >= 10447
	• at the same time, be able to specify certain zip codes or zip ranges to be excluded, e.g. >=10440 AND <=10447 AND <> 10441

Attached, some screenshots of how the agents filter the zip codes today, in their Siebel query.
column319:
Apex Class:
 * CustomerSearch_CTRL - new method's argument added (list of postal code filter criteria)
 * SRV_TeleAppQueryHelper - new functionality for generating query based on Postal Code Filter Criteria

LWC:
 * teleAppPostalCodeEditor - new component responsible for gathering all criteria provided by Tele Agent
 * customerSearch - new teleAppPostalCodeEditor component added (+ communication between components)

column35:
Only Integration User can edit Contacts created by Integration User.

Contacts created by others than Integration or migration user can be edited provided the user has access to the Contact

After user changes contact data in Legacy CRM systems, changes are propagated also to SF.
After user changes contact data in SF, changes are propagated also to Legacy CRM systems.
Newly created contacts in Legacy CRM systems are propagated to SF

column35:
As a SF user, when I see lists of contact records, I must be able to identify the inactive contacts based on field Status.

Therefore, I must be able to view the contact Status field in the below use cases:
• In the Account's Related Contacts related list, the contact's Status field should be also visible as a related list column
• In all Contact List Views
• In the Teleappointments' Contact list of the next account to be called
• In the Add Contact Roles contact selection list (this list appears when the user clicks "Add Contact Roles" on Contact Roles of Opportunity object) - see attached screenshot

In addition, when I hover over a field that is a lookup to a Contact, I need to be able to also view the contact's Status in the respective compact layout.

column1: Reason for closure GR lead values
column35:
As a SF user, when I reject a lead, I must choose one of the following GR specific values in the "Reason for Closure" picklist field:
 * Not interested
 * Not eligible for offer
 * Prefers competitor
 * Rejected consent
 * Not reachable
 * On going lead/opportunity
 * Unavailability of service
 * Mapping for future sale

In addition, when the reason is “Mapping for future sale”, the system should require user to define a date in "Follow up Date" field with a date after the current date. This value must also update the respective field on the related Account record. In case User selects this value on a lead with no related account, he should get an error message “a related account must exist in order to choose this value”.
Related to USSFA-799
column178:
# When user changes status to closed-not converted, the available values in the reason for Closure are:

 * Not interested
 * Not eligible for offer
 * Prefers competitor
 * Rejected consent
 * Not reachable
 * On going lead/opportunity
 * Unavailability of service
 * Mapping for future sale

3. If Reason for Closure = mapping for future sale, the field Follow-up Date is mandatory

4. Follow-up Date is a field available and editable by user on the layout

5. Follow-up Date cannot be earlier than TODAY()

6. Once the Follow-up Date is populated, the value is copied to Follow-up Date on related Account (from the field Account)

7. In case User selects "Mapping for future sale" on a lead with no related account, he should get an error message “a related account must exist in order to choose this value”.
column316:
As a SF user, when I reject a lead, I must choose one of the following GR specific values in the "Reason for Closure" picklist field:
o	Not interested
o	Not eligible for offer
o	Prefers competitor
o	Rejected consent
o	Not reachable
o	On going lead/opportunity
o	Unavailability of service
o	Mapping for future sale

In addition, when the reason is “Mapping for future sale”, the system should require user to define a date in "Follow up Date" field with a date after the current date. This value must also update the respective field on the related Account record. 
In case User selects this value on a lead with no related account, he should get an error message “a related account must exist in order to choose this value”.

Related to USSFA-799
