column387: 16/Feb/21 8:00 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi]  please check Andras' comment above, also we have decided with Andras to use "average number of calls per day in the last 30 days" instead of "this month", please let me know if ok. We were thinking, that it gives you better overview than "this month" because during the first couple of days of the month it will not show you reliable data - if 1 Feb is a Friday and I made 200 calls, then on Monday 4th morning it will say I have done 50 calls per day, which is not really true. What do you think?
column388: 18/Feb/21 1:33 PM;oana.ene;[~tkiritsi] and [~ELeodi] - we need a feedback asap pls.
column389:
18/Feb/21 5:26 PM;ELeodi;[~oana.ene] , [~jkomorowska]

regarding this user story as per acceptance criteria and Andras comment
 # Regarding : My Pending Call-backs  (past & today)  :   

 * 1-36 color Green,
 * 37-50 color Orange,
 * 51+ color Red .

will we have an option to change the ranges of each color in the future if needed?

      2. Regarding My Average # of calls per day this month:

First we want it to be per month  and not the last 30 days.

From this report we want to exclude Weekends. To be more specific about our need, on this report should be included only the days of the month that the agent has created  at least one call item. if the agent doesn't log a call then we assume that this was not a working day for him .

     3.Regarding the report chart component (most likely a donut chart) showing the # of Opps created by the active user this month, per Account Manager (and the respective underlying report).:
 * On Andras image tile “Total # of calls for last 30 days” should be renamed to “Total # of Opportunities this month”
 * This report should also be per month and it should show opportunities created by the active user this month, per Account Manager
 * We don’t need different coloring per opportunity number for this report. We can use only green color for it

cc: [~tkiritsi]
column390:
19/Feb/21 12:08 AM;jkomorowska;[~ELeodi] 

1. Coloring clear, but one more question - the call-backs past and today is one number, right? You don;t want to see separately past and separately today?

 2. what you want will increase the estimation - removing weekends and no call days is additional logic to be implemented, for the moment I'm not even sure how to achieve that, so we need to park this until we align internally

3. the report for opps is not included in the picture, we misunderstood and created a report you don't need;)

17/Mar/21 1:42 PM;tkiritsi;[~kwojtczak] [~jkomorowska]

c.c. [~mtzouma] [~dmyriounis] [~ELeodi] [~oana.ene]

Unfortunately it seems that we have a problem .

I thought that TS agents would be like Sales users , i mean they did not need to have the manage report perimission set in order to have access to their Home page.

The TS agents belong to an external company . I talked to them about giving to all users the manage report permission set , and they said no , as this is against their internal policy - the user should not have access to the kpis of another user.

I realize that without this permission set the lovely Home page we have created will be useless as they will not be able to see it 😕.

Is there a solution on this ? Please advice
column402:
17/Mar/21 2:20 PM;kwojtczak;[~tkiritsi] there are no problems, only challenges ;)  

 

I checked this problem once again and I see that the reason why its not displaying is the filter on Component Visibility 

Should be User> Profile > Name Contains Teleappointment Agent 

I worked with the permissions so the current GROTE Teleappointement Agent profile should be enough to show the dashboard as on the screen below. 

 

Sorry for the inconvenience. 

 

 

!image-2021-03-17-12-16-22-622.png!
column404:
23/Mar/21 3:15 PM;pdlugosz;Tested on: https://ote--grotsptest.lightning.force.com/lightning/page/home

Now new dashboard is visible on Homepage for Tele-appointment agents but there are still some things to fix:
 !DashboardTeleApp.png|thumbnail! 
- change name of dashboard to e.g. Tele-appointment Dashboard
- remove number of ticket (USSFA-3941)
- in the middle should be displayed: *My Average # of calls per day this month* report not My Average Calls of this Month furthermore according with AC report should show calls but now it counts Opportunities related to CLI where Call Date in Last 30 Days.
- My Pending Callbacks should display past and today activities but now filter is set to less than TODAY than* less or equal* than TODAY:
 !LessThanTODAY.png|thumbnail!
column405: 24/Mar/21 12:13 PM;pdedic;To display relevant results in report "My Average # of calls per day this month", SF needs to know number workdays per calendar month, but this is not available by any function. The only solution is to have this stored as data in SF and use it in a LWC which would be displayed instead of a regular report.
column406: 24/Mar/21 1:05 PM;dmyriounis;[~pdedic] so I believe this will affect the solution design, and  USSFA-5041 bug cannot be delivered yet. Is that correct?
column407:
25/Mar/21 10:43 AM;kwojtczak;[~dmyriounis] USSFA-5041 was related only for visibility of the dashboard and this is being delivered (we saw some overwritten repository things but this is being fixed). 

Here in this story the solution design might be changed but to the report only. The display of the homepage would be the same but only we need to check report criteria if the appropriate data is displayed.

- - Supervisor TS Outbound Direct Team 
- - - TS Outbound Direct Team Agent

column316:
This story extents the original "Customer search" story (USSFA-3048).

Additional criteria Users should be able to use for running queries:
- last event reason (one of the pick list values) 
- last event created (range of dates)

In addition, query form fields should be re-organized as follows:

1st column/group of criteria fields (From – To), top to bottom order: 
1.	SFA Address (Postal Code)
2.	Account Owner (not from – to field but must be second)
3.	Quantity
4.	Amount of Responses
5.	Potential Total Value
6.	Employees
7.     Is Decision Maker flag

2nd column/group of criteria (From – To date fields), top to bottom order:
1.	Follow-up Date
2.	Last Response Date
3.	Expiry Date
4.	Last Opportunity Created Date
5.	last event created

3rd column/group of criteria (Multi picklist fields), left to right order:
Account Division (left up)
Last Response Type (right up) etc
Competitors
Product Group
Status for Mobile
Status for Fix
Status for ICT
Last Opportunity Sales Stage
Customer Segment
Industry (Occupation Type)
last event reason

column319:
Validation rule and ByPass mechanism for Admin and Integration profiles: 
|*IsExternalIdOfParentPopulated*
IF(
OR(
$Setup.coredt__AutomationConfiguration__c.coredt__IsIntegrationBypass__c,
$Setup.coredt__AutomationConfiguration__c.coredt__IsAdministratorBypass__c),
false,
AND(NOT(ISBLANK(ParentId)),ISBLANK(coredt__ParentAccountExternalId__c))|

column1: GR Assign dummy user to new Accounts
column35:
The Account assignment in GR will continue to be maintained in Legacy. As is process: 
-Some of these accounts are vacant for a long period of time (the account manager is on a leave of absence for a log period of time) and  are assigned to a common user called "COSMOREAD" in legacy .
-Some accounts always remain  "unassigned"  and are now assigned in legacy in a dummy/generic user "SADMIN"
-Every new account that is created , is automatically assigned to SADMIN as well (either directly or through lead conversion)
The requirement is for SF to "inherit" this info for legacy somehow , both  for unassigned &  vacant accounts , while newly created accounts in SF must be automatically assigned to a generic account owner (account creation / lead conversion)
column178: For every new Account (created from SF not integration) from Lead conversion or directly, the Account Owner should be set to SADMIN
column316: In case an account is assigned to dummy user in Siebel it should be replicated in SF (either "Cosmoread" or "Sadmin")
column319: When Account is created trigger to assign the newly created Account to SADMIN based on the custom setting (custom setting Global Setting already exists from previous US)

column35:
1. Tele agents needs to be able to change the owner of the opportunity while these are on status "Qualifed lead" & "Qualification" (not further statuses). The reason for that is that sometimes they make a mistake and assign the opportunity to the wrong account manager or themselves (if they will be the owners by default , unless they change it) 

2. The Tele appointments supervisor must be able to reasign the pending call backs of agent A to agent B (usually in the case of long unexpected absence of agent A)

If record type = Draft

Account field Type -> Default value = Customer , Competitor should not be a valid choice.

Account field Type -> Default value = Competitor , no other choices should be available
column178:
Account Competitor Products and Accounts with RT = Competitor should not be synced 

If record type = Draft

Account field Type -> Default value = Customer , Competitor should not be a valid choice. 

 If record type = Competitor

Account field Type -> Default value = Competitor , no other choices should be available

 

Developer note: 

All AC is passing with 1 exception: event is still triggered on insert of Competitor. 

With current implementation we can't stop this as decision to send integration record on insert to legacy is done in harmonized and not respecting natco specific logic in flow. Modifying that behavior would require bypass implementation with mechanism of temporary Id (no record Id available in SF on before insert flow, changes in both harmonized and natco) or change in very core of integration that would require regression test of whole integration.

Since updates of such account won't be triggering event and create event should fail in mulesoft we recommend to leave it like this at least for now.

column35:
During the call , the agent must capture both the “sales” response as well as the “consent” response.

The agent will ask for the oral consent from the contact (calls are being recorded)

Following that an information needs to be sent to the client:  the agent must select a channel (sms/email) and a summary will be sent to client by a different system then CMS. 

So we imagine a process like that :

User asks on the phone about the consent

Negative answer > User presses button “Negative Consent”  , which sets the status field to the value “Oral - Rejected”. - This action should result, in the anonymization of the contact.

Positive answer -> User presses button “Positive Consent”  , which sets the status field to the value “Oral Consent”. This action triggers Salesforce to notify our legacy system that an informative message should be sent to the contact.

When this process finishes successfully and the message is sent , legacy informs back Salesforce and status changes to “Consent Given”.  During the stage of “Oral Consent” , status field must not be editable  

These 2 buttons should only be editable when status field is in status “none”.

 

 

the sequence diagram here:[https://confluence.dtoneapp.telekom.net/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=77967471]

The new / updated part is the beginning (01-05) and changes to consent acquisition – (17-20). 

Basically oral consent given is passed thru ConsentAcquisitions endpoint of PartyPrivacy Management API ([https://confluence.dtoneapp.telekom.net/display/HAL/Party+Privacy+Management+API+4.8]) and based on this back-end can send SMS / E-mail or do anonymization. Also if Oral Consent is rejected it is synced as a consent update thru Kafka.
column178:
# Telesales agent can submit a Status of the Consent related to the contact he/she is calling only when there is no Consent Status information for the Contact yet (Status = None)
 # Telesales agent can select Status "Oral - rejected" which will send the info to CMS, CMS will send info to legacy to anonymize Contact, anonymized info will be sent to SF
 # Telesales agent can select Status "Oral consent", in that case a delivery method needs to be selected: sms or email, in case sms is selected Mobile phone needs to be filled in, in case email is selected Email field needs to be filled in
 # If status is "Oral consent" the Status cannot be changed manually from SF, an update will come from CMS to change the Status to "Consent given"
 # System admin and Business Admin profiles should be able to change the Status field on Consent any time
column316: As a Product Owner I want to anonymise data of the Contact in case the consent for GDPR was rejected, so that I am fulfilling GDPR rules.

column390:
22/Feb/21 5:06 PM;ktsamkosoglou;Hello,

 

Our proposal is a list of characteristics to be added in partyPrivacyProfileTypes.

In our case, if a characteristic with name *OralConsent* has been set with value *true* we procced with the flow corresponding to the OralConsents.

If the characteristic is not present or the value of the characteristic *OralConsent* is *false* the normal flow will be triggered.

 

Thank you

column392: 22/Feb/21 7:17 PM;jkomorowska;[~ktsamkosoglou] we have 2 scenarios here: OralConsent and OralRejected. OralRejected is not the same as no OralConsent or OralConsent false. for OralRejected anonymization of the contact should happen in legacy, so does it belong to "normal flow"?
column393: 22/Feb/21 7:39 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~ktsamkosoglou] What does this mean? Do you want to add this in order to have it sent to SalesForce? Is there going to be coming later a non-oral consent?
column394:
22/Feb/21 8:52 PM;ktsamkosoglou;We want the characteristics structure in order to distinguish the following scenarios:

 
 * When the characteristic *OralConsent* is not present the existing flow will be triggered.
 * When the characteristic *OralConsent* is present and it has value *authorized* the new flow will be triggered.
 ** An email/sms will be sent to the subscriber about his/her consent approval.
 ** After the subscriber sucessfully informed UCM and SalesForce should be updated with accept status.
 * When the characteristic *OralConsent* is present and it has value *unauthorized* the new flow will be triggered.
 ** UCM and SalesForce should be updated with the rejected status.

 Is that ok?

We will need to involve the HAL team either way though, so I am adding this to their backlog as well. THanks.  

Gabor

column35:
When creating contact, user should select Role of this contact. which should be populated to AccountContactRelation - field: Roles.

If Role is changed on Contact, it should be updated on AccountContact Relationship 

Field: Roles on Account Contact Relationship should be mandatory 

Validation that only one role can be chosen in Roles on Account Contact Relationship

On the create contact form we need a new field “Role” that must be mandatory to save the new contact

A “Role” field must also exist on the Lead creation form – not mandatory for the creation of the lead , but  mandatory when converting a Lead to a Contact (the user must get an error message that he cannot convert to contact without setting a value on the Role field)

The list of values for the Role field on Lead & on Contact object will be the same and  as follows:
 * CEO
 * CIO
 * Information Security Officer
 * Chief Digital Officer
 * IT Manager
 * Procurement
 * Finance
 * SFA Sales
 * Marketing
 * Personal Assistant / Secretary
 * IT
 * Legal *

For contacts : Legal, we need a validation , so that these values will not be available for the SF user to select .
column316: As a Sales Organization Member I have to fill in specific contact role on contact creation, so that I have the key information on single page.

 * Legal *

This solution exists for HR under USSFA-1980

Account: CRU

Task:CRUD 
Contact:CRU
Consent:RU (+ 'Status' field - read/write)

This story is dependent on USSFA-969 and USSFA 979.
column316:
As a Teleappointment Agent, I need to be able to create a new account (of default account type customer), so that I can set appointments with accounts that don't already exist in SF. These accounts won't be managed accounts, so the teleapp agent won't be the actual Account owner (from a business perspective). This is linked with SADMIN issue- USSFA 979.

Business requirement: 
Teleappoitnment Agent should be able to create new Accounts in Salesforce
mandatory fields same as sales profile users (account name, VAT, sfa address, owner)

 # why would they create new Accounts? The functionlaity is for them to call existing Accounts

column383:
08/Oct/20 5:44 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

 

1.While talkining to existing customers they may come across to customers that inform them that they are owners of another company as well. Sometime it even happens that they have no interest to create an opportunity and get in touch to an Account manager for the existing company , but for the new one . It is then that we create the new account .

2.Even if you give us this functionality on December , we wont use it before we get the whole thing and on board all account managers , so in the mean time we are safe even if you dont block the account creation

column178: during a call the user must be able to choose calendar view of any account manager and see their availability
column316:
As a Teleappointment Agent, I need to be able to access all account managers' calendar, so that I can view his availability and set an appointment with a client in a proper date and time

Business requirement: 
Teleappoitnment Agent should be able to access all calendars during the call with the client
column319:
There are two approaches to achieve all requirements. Both require manual steps:
 * First Approach - it allows tele agents to see sales managers' calendars without events' details
 ** Tele Agent steps:
 *** Open Calendar Tab
 *** Click gear icon next to 'Other Calendars'
 *** Click 'Add Calendars'
 *** Type name of sales manager and click 'Add'
 *** Repeat for other users (it can be done by System Admin)
 * Second Approach - it allows tele agents to see sales managers' calendars with events' details
 ** Sales Manager steps:
 *** Open Calendar Tab
 *** Click arrow button next to 'My Events' (under 'My Calendars')
 *** Click 'Share Calendar'
 *** Type name of tele agent that you want to share calendar (with events' details)
 *** Select 'Show Details and Add Events' Access and click 'Done'
 *** Repeat for other tele agents (it can be done by System Admin)
 ** Tele Agent steps:
 *** The same steps as in the first approach (for each tele agent)
column382:
17/Dec/20 1:27 PM;pmalicki;[~ELeodi] [~tkiritsi] [~mtzouma]

I've updated solution design with all manual steps required to allow tele agents to see sales managers' calendars.

Regarding yesterday's discussion on event's visibility, I've investigated the topic and this is summary:
 * Please be aware that tele agents can see only Event records in shared calendar (event though sales manager will add other items (e.g. Call Backs))
 * Even though the second approach allows tele agents to see events' details, tele agents cannot edit them (because they don't have permission to update events that are not owned by them)

This is a standard approach. Of course we can think about a custom component on event record page that will omit system permission and allows to update Start and End date of event.

cc: [~jkomorowska]
column383:
18/Dec/20 12:45 PM;tkiritsi;[~pmalicki] [~jkomorowska]

c.c.[~mtzouma] [~ELeodi]

The business need is that TS agent must have access to the Calendar of the Account managers he/she works for.By access we mean ,ability to see the details of these events as well the ability to edit them .Note that each month we may have changes on the allocation between TS agents & Account managers .That’s why we are ok with the manual steps that the agent will have to make , but don’t want to ask for manual steps from the Account manager as well. So somehow we should make sure that TS agent has access to edit the events of sales profile users “by design” . The only exception on that would be the events related to Confidential accounts .
column384:
25/Jan/21 5:12 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi] [~mtzouma] [~ELeodi] 
The requirement about editing existing event of a sales rep is not in scope of this US. I have talked to Piotr, who made some investigation and there is a solution for it, but we should take it with a separate US
FYI [~oana.ene]

25/Jan/21 6:01 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c.[~oana.ene] [~mtzouma] [~ELeodi]

Aggreed , we will continue the ckeck of this u.s. with the manual steps as a work around and lets write a new user story.

Who can help me write the new one? Can Piotr share his investigation with Marina , so Marina and me will write the new one ?
column386: 25/Jan/21 6:23 PM;jkomorowska;The requirement can be as stated in your comment from december, the proposed solution would be to change the visibility of all calendars so that everyone can see the details (then no manual step is required, but I'm not sure if that is acceptable) and add a custom component visible only to teleagents to be able to modify Events. We would also need to think what should be editable - only etsrt/end or also other fields? [~tkiritsi]

c.c.[~aanagnostopoulos] [~ELeodi]

The Tele agents create directly opportunities and assign them to account managers , they dont convert leads.

When an agent selects response =Opportunity , opportunity creation is mandatory and user is navigated to Opportunity creation

Pre populated fields on Opportunity should be :
 # Account Name

column384:
15/Oct/20 7:55 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska] [~pmalicki]

c.c.[~aanagnostopoulos] [~ELeodi]

Is it possible to send a notification to the account manager, when the TS agent assigns to him a new opportunity ?
column385:
19/Oct/20 8:06 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi] [~ELeodi] [~pmalicki] [~aanagnostopoulos]

Neither VAT nor SFA Contact are fields on the Opportunity, so we can't really pre-populate it. Same thing goes for Notes and Products - they are not a field on the Opportunity, they are related objects, so it's difficult to make them mandatory.
 # I suggest we don't add VAT to Opportunity, it's not a characteristic of the Opp but the Account
 # Adding SFA Contact to Opp is complicated and requires some coding, I would also like to ask you to drop this req for the moment. User can see the SFA Contact on the Account
 # Instead of Notes I suggest to make the Description field mandatory.
 # Do you want the Telesales to pick exact Products or just the product family ( like Mobile Solutions, Security, Public Cloud...)? If it's the Product Family, we can add it as a field and make it mandatory
column386:
21/Oct/20 2:54 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c [~aanagnostopoulos] [~ELeodi]

ok i see your points

I aggree for 1 (VAT) & 2 (SFA contact) that they should not be populated on opp, as they area related

For point 3 , we can have description as mandatory to begin with . After implementing the u.s. on Notes , we should switch to Notes.

For the products , the Product family is not enough.

The business need is to make sure that the TS agent does not forget to write the description and the exact related products , before assigning the opportunity to the account manager. 

So maybe the validation should be that after saving the opportunity (with themselves as owners) , they cannot change the assignment of the opportunity to the account manager , unless they have chosen a related product and filled in the description field. 

Also i have made a previous comment about sending a notification to the AM when assigning him a new opp. Now in production the new owner of the opp. gets an email . Can he get an in app notification instead ?
column387:
21/Oct/20 7:42 PM;pmalicki;[~tkiritsi]

cc: [~aanagnostopoulos] [~ELeodi] [~jkomorowska]

 

I think it's possible to get a notification in SF app when owner of an opportunity record is changed. Let me investigate it further when I'll start working on this user story.

column35:
As a Teleappointment Agent, I need to be able to set a call back on specific contact, so that I know I have to contact this client again on the date and time specified

Business requirement: 
- as result of call, agent can set "Call Back".

After selecting this option, a new task will be created with the date and time of the call back.

the Account will not appear on any list even if it matches the criteria and the account will appear above calls to the agent that has set the call back when the call back date and time equals or is smaller than the system date and time

when a user that has pending call backs begins to work on any list, his call backs will be above all and must appear to the user from oldest call back date and time to newest call back date and time

I will see all call backs in the list

When I realize the call back I need to be able to set the response in the same way as for new call list items

New custom field:
 * Call Back Date (on Activity object) - admins and tele agent profiles - read/write permission
 * Call Back (on Activity object) - technical flag - admins and tele agent profiles (read/write permission)
 * Call Back Id (on Call List Item object) - technical field - admins and tele agent profiles (read/write permission)

Validation Rule:

Apex Class:

 * TeleApp_CTRL - updated to retrieve all user's call backs
 * DMN_CallListItem - validation updated
 * APP_Register - task selector registered
 * BLD_Task - builder class for task object
 * SRV_TeleAppQueryHelper - exclusion of call backs
 * TRH_CallListItem - checking tasks when item is created/updated

LWC:
 * teleAppCurrentCallItem - new page structure (html and css files)
 * teleAppResponseHandler - new task page navigation added

column384:
18/Nov/20 5:29 PM;pmalicki;Hi [~tkiritsi], [~ELeodi], [~aanagnostopoulos], [~jkomorowska]

I've made some small changes after sprint review call: 
 * new validation rule was added - call back date cannot be set in the past
 * user can create call back task from every place (the system will treat every task that has call back date populated as call back task). Is Call Back flag is still hidden and it's used only in validation rule (so we can be sure that call back is created with call back date)

I've also checked whether it's possible to set default value on due date field - unfortunately we cannot do it with current configuration. There are few solutions:
 * Due Date is no longer mandatory for all type of tasks - so call backs can be created without this field
 * Due date is no longer mandatory (on page layout) but new validation rule is created (that throws an error every time when task is not call back and due date is not provided) - call backs can be created without this field
 * Due Date is no longer mandatory (on page layout) but new validation rule is created (that throws an error every time when task is not call back and due date is not provided) and trigger/process is created (that populates due date based on provided call back date) - call backs always have due date populated (either by user or trigger)

As a Teleappointment Agent, I need to be able to create query based on various query criteria, so that I search for specific clients 

Business requirement: 
Users should be able to build queries using the following query criteria:: 
Customer Segment
Potential Total Value
Employees
Decision Maker flag
Industry (Occupation Type)
SFA Address Postal Code
Account Division
Account Owner
Follow-up Date
Last Response Created Date
Last Response Type
Last Opportunity Created Date
Last Opportunity Sales Stage
Amount Of Responses
Competitor Name
Product Group
Expiry_date
Quantity
Status for Fix
Status for Mobile
Status for ICT
column319:
LWC:
 * customerSearch
 ** displays all criteria fields with proper format
 ** retrieves all possible values for each picklist that is part of criteria
 ** handles value changes and formats it before sending to apex controller
 ** handles errors returned by system
 ** displays number of returned records and gives possibility to submit the list

Apex Class:
 * SRV_TeleAppQueryHelper - based on criteria provided by users, retrieves accounts and returns their ids
 * CustomerSearch_CTRL - apex controller that handles actions triggered by customerSearch lwc component

New fields:
 * Account:
 ** Amount of Responses - roll up summary field that stores the number of call list items that are finished
 ** Last Response Date - roll up summary field that stores the datetime of the last response (call list item that is finished)
 ** Postal Code (Digits Only) - technical formula field that removes all spaces and dashes from shipping postal code and converts it to number type
 * Call List:
 ** List Size - roll up summary field. Stores number of all call list items
 ** Active - formula field that calculates whether call list is still active (when is cancelled or all call items are finished, it becomes inactive)
 ** Cancelled - checkbox field that indicates whether list was cancelled by tele agent
 ** Number Of Active Calls - roll up summary field that stores number of call items that are not called yet
 * Call List Item:
 ** Account - master detail to Account
 ** Call List - master detail to Call List
 ** Call Date - date and time when call list item is done 
 ** Comments
 ** Contact - lookup to contact that was called
 ** Response Type

column178:
while working on a list, all priority rules must apply and clients to call must appear in that order

column316:
As a Teleappointment Agent, I need to have my query results sorted based on set criteria rules, so that I don't have to manually sort or prioritise clients

Business requirement: 
- criteria to sort the query are given on system level 
1. Call back (if on the same user) 
2. Date of last communication with the contact (the older communication the higher on the list, based on Date) 
3. Response on Campaigns (based on Priority of the Account response) 
4. Number of attempts to call the client (less attempts - higher on the list) 

Regarding 3. Response on Campaigns (based on Priority of the Lead response) the responses are prioritized as following (so the third priority rule contains the followin prioritizarion)
1.Call Back (it comes above all when the time of the call back comes)
2.Opportunity
3.Pending contact
4.Call again 
5.Voice mail/fax
6.Mapping for Future Sale
7. Not interested at the moment
8. Event
9. Competitors/other providers 
10. Member of group of companies
11. Not profit organization
12. Negative response
column319:
Custom Field:
 * ConvertedResponseDate__c (on Account object) - technical field. Stores only date from Last Response Date (Datetime field) - tele agent and admin profiles have read access
 * Order__c (on Call List Item object) - technical field. Stores an order of call list item calculated based on priority rule. Permissions: Tele Agent profile (read only), Admins (read/write)

Apex Class:
 * SRV_TeleAppAccountSorter - responsible for sorting accounts based on priority rules
 * SRV_CallListCreator - updated in order to use sorting service
 * BLD_CallListItem
 * SEL_CallList - sorting items based on Order field

column316:
As a Teleappointment Agent, I need to be able to Set a Response for each call, so that customer 360 contains result of my communications with the client


Business requirement: 
- agent is able to capture phone call Responses directly in Salesforce 
- the agent should be able to pick only one of the following responses from a picklist
1. Call back - when this response is selected, the user should set a call me back date and time and the action must be mandatory
2. Bankrupt -This response should set Account to Delisted as described in story "Delisted Accounts"
3. Invalid phone/communication info -  This response should set Account to Delisted as described in story "Delisted Accounts"
4. Negative rseponse 
5. Opportunity - agent should be able to create an opportunity for the specific account during the call. the opportunity creation must be mandatory
6. Lead - agent should be able to create a Lead for the specific account during the call. the lead creation must be mandatory
7. Low potentiality -  This response should set Account to Delisted as described in story "Delisted Accounts"
8. Pending contact
9. Call again 
10. Voice mail/fax
11. Competitors/other providers 
12. Member of group of companies
13. Not profit organization
14. Mapping for Future Sale - when this response is selected, the user should set a Follow up date that is greaterr than the system date and the action must be mandatory
15. Not interested at the moment
16.  - agent should be able to create an event for the specific account during the call. the event creation must be mandatory

Add “Notes” to objects leads/opportunities/events/tasks , so we can have specific time stamp for everyone’s notes on the same record (who ,what, when) .

We also need it for migration reasons as in our legacy it works that way , and we dont want to miss the history 

Please note that we will need this new Note feature to be available in all these objects in case they are created through Teleappointments functionality as well.

Please verify that after implementing this Note feature, when we migrate the Notes from Siebel to SF , the created by person will either be a user in SF (it can be an inactive user, but for that purpose NatCo will need to create the inactive users first) or the created by will be the user performing migraiton

column35:
+Regarding the System admin :+
 will have access to set up and configure features for other users
 will have access to confidential accounts
 delete everything (including confidential) - In case of Account deletion, Account will NOT be deleted in SBL (by synchronization)
 monitor application performance and logs
 configure users and assign them roles, profiles, permissions*
 is able to add users to groups that are managing queues*

*keep in mind that in Greece the same person will be both system & user admin , so he must be able to do both – unless he can be assigned to both profiles at the same time (I think that is not possible)

+Regarding the Business admin+ :
 wont have access to set up
 will have access to confidential accounts
 will flag confidential accounts

will be  able to set accounts hierarchy (other profiles should not be able) 

will be able to create accounts of type competitor (other profiles should not be able) 
 *should be able to view and modify all data  , except delete records that come from integration*

+Regarding the+ *+DT+* +System admin :+
 will have access to set up and configure features for other users
 will have access to confidential accounts
 monitor application performance and logs
 configure users and assign them roles, profiles, permissions.
 is able to add users to groups that are managing queues.

*Responsible for user administration (e.g. configure users and assign them roles, profiles, permissions , be able to add users to groups that are managing queues)*

+Read only:+
 Will have read only access to all records
 have access to confidential accounts for reporting reasons

 

Refer to attached CRU table for details

03/Nov/20 11:49 AM;kwojtczak;* Business Admin: added the modification so that he should see Confidential Accounts as well. Ready to be tested once merged CC:[~wmusiatowicz] 
 * When it comes to the Activities (Tasks and Events) you can Edit or Delete when once of the following conditions is met:

{quote}You can edit or delete an activity if:

 

You have the “Edit Tasks” and “Edit Events” permissions   

AND

 

You’re assigned to the activity

OR

 

You’re above the user assigned to the activity in the role hierarchy

OR

 

You have the “Modify All” object-level permission in the related record, where the record’s sharing model is “Controlled By Parent.” (with Shared Activities enabled, you need the “Modify All” object-level permission for at least one contact and the related record)

OR

 

You have the “Modify All Data” permission
{quote}
 

So we can play around only the Edit Task, Edit Events, Modify All Data permissions when managing the access to activities.  There is no Standard CRUD settings for this two objects. [~tkiritsi]  [~mtzouma]

Following a discussion with the GR team, we concluded in a rather simplified approach, avoiding the Contact Roles complexity. 

Contacts created by the Integration user should be read-only for all users in Salesforce. Only the Integration user should be able to update them further.

On the other hand, Contacts created by any other SFDC user should be editable in Salesforce but should not be synced to legacy.

Please let me know if you need further clarifications.

column35:
There is a need for vat number validation , that ensures that the given value represents a valid vat number according to the Greek state rules 
 As a Sales person , I need to be able to have exceptions to the above rule. These exceptions origin ONLY in the legacy system and carry an indication that allow Salesforce to exclude them from the standard validation rules.
 Vat Number Validation rule
 • It consists of 9 digits. 
 • It must not be 000000000 or 999999999
 • We put aside the last digit. For all the rest , starting from the right , multiply with the power of 2 ( exponent will be the place of the digit ) . We add all the products created in the last step and divide the sum with 11. We take the division reminder and devide it by 10. This new division remainder must be the same with the digit that we put aside In the first step.

Example
 Vat Number = 143960980
 8*2 + 9*4 + 0*8 + 6*16 + 9*32 + 3*64 + 4*128 + 1*256 = 1396
 1396/11 = 126 and reminder  10
 10/10 = 1 and reminder  0
 0 is the same as the last digit , so validation = PASS

The validation should be bypassed by integration user, the validation should run only on Account creation, not edition
column316: need for vat number validation , that ensures that the given value represents a valid vat number according to the Greek state rules
column319:
IsValidVatId Validation Rule on Account

Error Condition:

    IF(
         OR(
             $Setup.coredt__AutomationConfiguration__c.coredt__IsIntegrationBypass__c,
             NOT(ISNEW())
         ),
         false,
         OR(
             LEN(coredt__VatId__c) != 9,
             coredt__VatId__c == '000000000',
             coredt__VatId__c == '999999999',
             MOD(
                 MOD(
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,8,1))*2+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,7,1))*4+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,6,1))*8+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,5,1))*16+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,4,1))*32+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,3,1))*64+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,2,1))*128+
                     VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,1,1))*256,

                    11

                ),

                10

            ) != VALUE(MID(coredt__VatId__c,9,1)) 
         )
     )

Error Message:

    Vat ID consists of 9 digits, can't be 000000000 nor

    999999999 and need to meet Greek-specific conditions.

Developer: Jakub Wszołkowski

column384:
31/Aug/20 11:46 AM;ipasialis;[~jkomorowska] , [~aanagnostopoulos] ,[~tkiritsi]

The above algorithm is correct. What has changed is that we do not want the extra field "Greek Tax Number" in the account model. 

1) If the account is created in Salesforce by a user then always run the Vat check as the algorithm dictates.

2) If the account is coming through integration , do not check anything.

 

The business logic behind this requirement is that our master legacy system has already some logic about allowing some exceptions to the vat number validation. We do not want Salesforce to create such exceptions on its own - that's why we need the validation in place for the users .

 On the other hand , we need a way to allow "vat exceptions" through integration . This can be done by bypassing the validation for all the synch/integration process.

column35:
As a SF user I must not be able to make changes in particular fields after the new Account is created / synced in legacy. 
 Same logic goes for accounts that are created from migration. We must set the fields that must not be synced out(update data model for GR) ,once initially created from legacy.

All *account fields* must be *read only and sync IN* , after the account is succesfully synchronized from legacy.

Neither sys nor business admin must have access to edit them.

SF will receive any changes made in legacy.

Exceptions to the above , are the following account fields
 # Fax                                                                         editable by SF users and none
 # Follow-up Date                                                 editable by SF users and none
 # Phone                                                                   editable by SF users and *IN/+*OUT*+*
 # Type (customer, partner , competitor)   editable by SF users and none
 # Website                                                               editable by SF users and none
 # Decision Maker flag                                        editable by SF users and *IN/+*OUT*+*
 # Shipping Address (SFA)                                 editable by SF users and *IN/+*OUT*+*

column1: GR SF SFA history In legacy - CR
column35:
|Read  high lever SF sfa history from legacy CRM (My cosmoview) , so that non SF users can have a view on customers' sfa history (upon specific account search on legacy)
 ·        Fields on Lead object , that we want to expose to My cosmoview : Lead ID (user friendly) Creation date , created by, Channel , Lead partner , Assigned to Queue , lead owner, lead status , reason for close ,Description , Area of interest  . The user  must be able to search by  creation date  by setting date_from , date_to, Lead partner of the lead
 ·        Fields on Opportunity object , that we want to expose to My cosmoview: Opp.ID  (user friendly)  Creation date , created by, Channel , Lead partner code, opportunity owner, opportunity  status , reason for close, related products (product name & quantity). The user  must be able to search by  creation date  by setting date_from , date_to                                                                                              
 ·        Fields on Event object , that we want to expose to My cosmoview : Creation date , created by, event type , Start date , End date  , Assigned To , location,  related contact (Name (First name), Name (Last name), -Contact Roles-). The user  must be able to search by  creation date  by setting  date_from , date_to (last 18 months)
 * we also need “Notes” to be added as a retrieved object from SF (expose to My cosmoview) .We will also migrate Notes from Siebel SFA into SF SFA both on leads & opps|

 
 We don’t want to expose tasks in My cosmoview
 Requires 3 new (#A.1 REST Inbound via HAL)  interfaces: Get Account’s Lead  , Get Account’s  Opportunity  , Get Account’s Events
 Please check which API will be used for Events
 Records of special customers with restrictions on viewing privileges , should not be migrated .|

Please have in mind that for every “fetch” operation +we want to pass a parameter regarding the aging of the records to fetch+ . For example 2 years

Finally
 * In fetch lead operation, we need to present user the Opportunity friendly identifier ( if is exists , if it converted to opportunity)
 * In fetch event operation , we also need to present the same Opportunity friendly identifier ( if the event is related to Opportunity)
 * When notes are to be implemented , we would like to present them in CosmoView with their related entity

For Notes, we definitely need to split this User Story and add Notes GET to USSFA-2616.

Within this US, For Lead, Opportunity and Account we plan to expose 3 APIs:
 * GetOpportunities (search criteria: VAT_ID)
 * GetEvents (search criteria: VAT_ID)
 * GetLeads (search criteria: LeadPartner OR VAT_ID, if both provided VAT_ID preveals)

Within USSFA-2616 please add relevant requirements for GetNotes.

As there is no business requirement for Aging on SF side, I suggest to implement filtering on Legacy side (based on returned data such as Lead status or 

Please note there are limits on SF for SOQL queries. So neither VatId based nor LeadPartner query will not return > 2000 rows.

[~jkomorowska], [~damkowalski] - changes in SF will be required to implement relevant SOQL queries.

column391:
18/Jan/21 2:17 PM;mjodlowski;Ioannis, 

My mistake - hard limit is 50k records. But this is only SF side. for Mulesoft - the more records, the higher memory requirements and to prove 50k limit end-to-end we would need to test it. Most likely we will add "soft limit" query parameter (e.g. 1000 records) - no paging mechanism is quoted within this user story (unless requested).

But to be pragmatic - what is the max number of Events or Opportunities associated with single VAT ID (could be many Accounts in SF)?

Last but not least - online query for records from last 2 years is quite unsual ([~Gabor.Fal] - for your information). I would rather recommend reporting solution for such amount of data.

Marek

Looking at above comments we are getting misleading requirements towards "aging". We can support the following options (non-exclusive):
 * maxRecords (number) (aka LIMIT): [https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.soql_sosl.meta/soql_sosl/sforce_api_calls_soql_select_limit.htm]
 * queryFrom (date) - field could be applied to CreatedDate field in Salesforce to obtain records not older than queryFrom

In case maxRecord is not provided, default value (property, not changeable during runtime) will be used to avoid performance issues (I propose 100 records - please share max/average records you would like to retireve. 

Regardless of queryFrom, maxRecords filtering (aka LIMIT in SOQL) will be applied.

 

We plan to prepare swaggers/samples by 22/01 under assumption IA will be confirmed not later than 21/01.

Thank you,

Marek

column425:
01/Feb/21 11:33 AM;ipasialis;[~amitkou] , [~mjodlowski] , [~theofani.ntamsa], [~tkiritsi] , [~mgiannat]

 

1) UX design is something internal that has been analyzed and agreed between local IT department and business. It is not subject for review and we have already asked for specific integration requirements.

2) If these integration requirements are being challenged , our local integration expert  , [~mgiannat] , has the authority and responsibility to discuss it with the respective ones from dt.  No UX discussion or negotiation can open here.

3) [~mjodlowski] we did not agree on caching on our side. Caching is out of question and CosmoView perfomance is something that the Greek team is accounted for. Deloitte responsibility is implementing the integration requirements that [~mgiannat] asked for.
column426:
01/Feb/21 12:53 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~ipasialis]

 

As stated, I am worried about the efficiency of the design of API calls behind the UX. I have communicated this Friday in the call and also sent separate email about it. What I would like to achieve to provide the best integration / APIs in order to have the best possible UX. I don't want to change the UI or the screen flows.  

Regarding caching, yes we did not agree that there will be caching, but I believe there should be some activity on OTE side to implement some caching. It is not efficient design if big amount of data is getting queried and then queried again when it is not changing just because there is no caching. With adding like Redis in memory cache component this could be solved easily.
column428: 02/Feb/21 1:01 PM;Gabor.Fal;[~amitkou] Thank you. It is a very nice design. Marek and me have looked into it, Marek will comeback with proposal on integration that can support good performance and experience for your users.

column1: (NatCo Test Case GR) Verify if emails are being captured and synced after EAC Configuration
column35:
After EAC was enabled and configured by Salesforce Admin and outlook account was connected by Salesforce User, who will be conducting the test:
 * Emails are being captured and synced and User is able to see them as activities on activity timeline of related records in Salesforce

 

Notes:
 * If Internal Domain was added to the list of Excluded Domains and Addresses, email address that communication will be conducted for test purposes, should outside of the domain. Otherwise email will not be captured and synced, since messages sent to each other within the excluded internal domain, considered to be internal communication.
 * Sometimes capturing and synchronization of emails by EAC can take up to 10-15 minutes.
column178: Emails are being captured and synced and User is able to see them as activities on activity timeline of related records in Salesforce

column35:
The following automation/validations are present in the system, turned off by default. Some should  be switched on

IsAccountAlreadySynchronized - USSFA-373 Account is not yet synchronized, StageName=Proposal, Account.IsDirty__c = true *NO*
 IsAccountOwner- USSFA-796 To change the Opportunity Owner, you need to be Owner of the related Account. *NO* 
 IsClosed.validationRule - USSFA-366 You can't modify record after Closed Stage if Bypass integration is not set *YES*
 IsLostReasonFilled - USSFA-366 You need to fill Lost Reason before selecting "Closed - Lost" stage. *YES*
 IsMovingForwardInStage -USSFA-373 You can't choose any Opportunity Stage which is before your currently selected one on the Sales Path *NO*
 IsMultiChannel - If Opportunity is Multichannel you must select Category and Sales Channel - *NO*
 IsOppLockedFromProposalStage - USSFA-362 / USSFA-1221 / USSFA-1030 You can't change Opportunity after entering Proposal stage. *NO*

column178: One consent on the Contact: Marketing communication and storing of personal data
column316:
As a Sales Rep, I would like to see one consent on the Contact:
-  Marketing communication and storing of personal data with the following picklist values: not yet receieved, consent given, rejected.
column382:
28/Aug/20 3:08 PM;tkiritsi;[~oana.ene]

What do you mean  by “The consent needs to be in the status: consent given in order to save the contact.” ?

The contact will already have been created before we trigger the consent process either via lead conversion , or creation of a new contact in SF manually or via integration

Other than that we aggree.

c.c.[~aanagnostopoulos] [~d.sarlanis] [~ipasialis]
column383:
01/Oct/20 4:29 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi]

I guess i have written the part "The consent needs to be in the status: consent given in order to save te contact." but I don't know what it means either;) I think we can delete this part, unless you remember something additional
column384:
01/Oct/20 6:09 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

You are right , its just a mistake , delete this phrase

column35:
Consent process should apply only to Contacts created in SF, Individual and Consents should not be created for Contacts created by Integration 

Standard functionality for Sales users

We want a manual consent process (e.g. button) for the SF user

We need 5 consent statuses :
 * "none" = default value for any SF contact that exists in SF
 * Not yet received = interim value while the user has pressed the button until SF receives via integration the consent result (while in this status the consent button must be deactivated, the sys/bus admin must be able to change the status manually into null in order for the User to run the process again)
 * Consent given
 * Rejected
 * Oral consent *(validation is required so that this is available only for Tele appointments profile)*

We need 2 values for the “Communication Channel”  (created in https://jira.dtoneapp.telekom.net/browse/USSFA-2743) field : sms , email . This field must be mandatory ,before the User presses the consent button .There must also be a validation that a mobile phone or an email address exists on the contact level ,while the user selects a channel value

 

If consent status is “In progress” for e.g. 7 days ,we must re send the sms/email automatically as a reminder to the contact - This logic will be set in legacy side, not SF

If consent status is “In progress” for 3 months , the status must automatically be changed to rejected and contact must be anonymized- This will also be implemented in legacy side , anonymize contact and finally propagate this to Salesforce via the standard integration process for contacts

[Confluence Link|https://confluence.dtoneapp.telekom.net/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SFA&title=%2301.10%3A+Contact+anonymization+after+GDPR+Consent+not+received]
column178:
Consent process should not be available for Contacts created from legacy (where Created By has Profile = Integraiton User),  Individual and Consents should not be created for Contacts created by Integration 

When Contact is created (from conversion or not) the consents are created automatically

Consents should have default status "none"

User can push button "Acquire consent" to trigger the consent management system, status is changed automatically to "Not yet received"

User cannot push "Acquire consent" button/error is displayed when Status = Not yet received

User cannot change the Status field nor any other field on the Consent, except for sys admin dt sys admin, business admin, who can change status to "none" again

New field: Communication Channel, picklist with 2 values: sms, email, mandatory. In case Communication Channel = sms "Mobile" field is mandatory, in case Communication Channel = email, "Email" field is mandatory

column382:
28/Aug/20 3:11 PM;tkiritsi;[~oana.ene]

We want the consent process to take place +only for contact types that are created and mastered in SF+ (please see comment in relevant GR CR USSFA – 2627 «Contact Synchronization») .

So for legacy contacts the consent process must not be available .

We will neither create these SF contacts or store their consent in our legacy.

Therefore in the case that the consent is rejected , after SF is notified from integration about the rejection , there must be a SF process that will anonymize the contact in SF

So the below steps don’t apply in the process we want to implement

“Consent is stored in consent storage”

“anonymize in Sieble(DPS) and pushed to SFA”

 

c.c. [~aanagnostopoulos] [~d.sarlanis] [~ipasialis]

column386:
02/Oct/20 12:42 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c. [~oana.ene]

[~ipasialis]

[~aanagnostopoulos]

Below you can find our finals comments , based on the cr on confluence , after the meeting we had with Gabor:

 

Standard functionality for Sales users

We want a manual consent process (e.g. button) for the SF user

We need 5 consent statuses :
 * null/pending = default value for any SF contact that exists in SF
 * in progress = interim value while the user has pressed the button until SF receives via integration the consent result (while in this status the consent button must be deactivated, the sys/bus admin must be able to change the status manually into null in order for the User to run the process again)
 * consent given
 * consent rejected
 * Oral Consent *(validation is required so that this is available only for Tele appointments profile)*

We need 2 values for the “Channel” field : sms , email . This field must be mandatory ,before the User presses the consent button .There must also be a validation that a mobile phone or an email address exists on the contact level ,while the user selects a channel value

 

If consent status is “In progress” for e.g. 7 days ,we must re send the sms/email automatically as a reminder to the contact

This logic will be set in legacy side, not SF

If consent status is “In progress” for 3 months , the status must automatically be changed to rejected and contact must be anonymized

This will also be implemented in legacy side , anonymize contact and finally propagate this to Salesforce via the standard integration process for contacts

column35:
* *Leads* à Public read-only (cause you only wanted certain user profiles to be able to create/update Leads)
 * *Accounts* à Private (due to the confidential ones. Use of a Sharing Rule is required to make all non-confidential Accounts available to all Users).
 * *Contacts* à Controlled by parent (if a user is able to see an Account then should be able to see it’s Contacts too)
 * *Activities* à controlled by parent (similar to the above, should be able to see it’s Activities too)
 * *Opportunities* à Private and add once again a sharing rule to give every user visibility to all Opps that do not belong to confidential Accounts (there is a GR specific USSFA 1070 for the confidential accounts )
column178:
* *Leads* are Public read-only
 * *Accounts* are Private with sharing rule to share all except confidential Accounts to all users
 * *Contacts* are Controlled by parent
 * *Activities* are controlled by parent 
 * *Opportunities* are Private and add once again a sharing rule to give every user visibility to all Opps that do not belong to confidential Accounts (there is a GR specific USSFA 1070 for the confidential accounts )

# If port out request is created in legacy system for customer, new task is created in Salesforce from external system and assigned to Account Owner.
 2. Account Owner is able to see and update the newly created task.
 # information about port out is available for reporting in Category field (*PORT OUT MOBILE*, *PORT OUT FIXED*) - values should be visible but not possible to choose for SF users, they will come from legacy, Category field should be read-only.
 #  After 48 hours from creation, tasks with Port out mobile and port out fixed values in the Category fields need to change status to closed
 # new field , orderId - text field , 255 char , and there is not need to be visible in the screen, sync direction IN
 # In order to find the correct Task to update ExternalId field will be used, on creation legacy will fill in this field with a combination of  VAT Id + orderId + _"PortOut" e.g. 123456789~1234~MOBILE_
 # When Task is closed the ExternalId field will be upended with _"~closed_date"_ value e.g. _123456789~1234~MOBILE__~01012021_

 * Category field is added to Task's GR Default Layout as read only field
 * New workflow, called *CloseTaskInTwoDays*, which closes the task ( *Close The Task* field update ) in 2 days after record creation, if created by Integration User and Category equals one of 2 new values
 * Updated already existing *Task GR* Process with 2 new actions:
 ** Set "Assigned To" field value to Account Owner when PORT OUT Task is created
 ** Append close date to External Id, when PORT OUT Task is closed
 * Order ID field already exists as harmonized field.

This is why we need the upsert solution.  I think we need a small discussion on this

column405:
21/Jan/21 11:53 AM;ipasialis;[~jkomorowska] , [~mjodlowski] , [~tkiritsi] , [~mgiannat] , [~theofani.ntamsa]

Here I will explain the exact criteria that affect the upsert process

 

1)  You will get the total number of customer lines that are going to be ported out , in the field comments. In each subsequent call , this field will contain the sum we want - so there is no need for Salesforce to "construct" the running total. It will be sent be us , in this field , ready to be updated as it is

2) We want a 6 hour timer on this kind of tasks . After 6 hours , tasks need to change status to closed.

3)  [~mgiannat] has asked in the interface agreement excel file , for a new field , orderId.  This field contains a value , based on which you will decide in Salesforce if it is a create action or an update action. The rule will be like :

If there is a Task , on this customer ( based on vat_id) , of this type ( based on field category) , with this value ( based on the field orderId )  ,   with status = Not Started     -->  Then it is an update

If not  – > It is a create.

If there is any question on the above please contact me directly.
column406: 22/Jan/21 7:22 PM;jkomorowska;[~ipasialis] there is no "Comment" field on Task. Ca we use "Description" or will it be used for something else?
column407:
24/Jan/21 1:39 PM;mjodlowski;Ioannis, standard SF functionality was planned - Upsert. Which means if you send Task with the same business identifier (used to match existing object in SF, _coredt____ExternalId___c) - [https://confluence.dtoneapp.telekom.net/display/SFA/12.+Unique+Identifiers+Mapping]

We could use combination of taxId + orderId + _"PortOut"_ as externalId, but this will not work due to the new "close after 6 hours" logic, thus if you wish to have conditional create/update we need to revise estimates and it surely will have impact on further planning :( Hope you understand :( I may also propose to implement "close after 6 hours" logic on your side - this way it will work perfectly fine - Legacy would need to keep trace of tasks created in SF and control ExternalId identifiers accordingly to leverage from ootb Upsert functionality

Last but not least, since for testing we use US description we really need all those details collected in US DoD.

Marek

column411:
28/Jan/21 3:46 PM;mjodlowski;MoM 28/01/2021
 # HAL and SF model for relating objects is based on ExternalId of the related SF objects.
 #  Options:

 ## GR stores masterId of the Account and sends within EDA Inbound to SF (and used for other operations) - vat id is not used.
 ## Mulesoft implements necessary enrichment. SF changes in data model are required
 ## SF adds custom external Id on Account (VAT ID). Mulesoft implements conditional calls to SF (natco based) to choose appropriate external Id.
 ## Enrichment implemented on Legacy side based based on query from master system.

Architecturally preferred option: 4.

Options 2 and 3 may have on other NatCos (SF and Mulesoft regression).

Action plan - evaluate options (Deloitte 2,3, GR: 1,4)

Leads will be created from Salesforce as well as from an outside application - Cosmoview. The following fields should be part of the creation process in SF:

 
|*Field*|*One to many*|*Mandatory from legacy*|*Requested By*|*Example*|*Comments*|
|VAT ID|N|*FALSE*| |097898787| |
|Company|N|*TRUE*| |ΠΑΣΠΑΤΗΣ ΚΑΛΑΦΑΤΗΣ Κ ΣΙΑ| |
|Lead Channel|N|*FALSE*| |Cosmote Shops| |
|Lead Partner|N|*FALSE*| |ΤΕΚ ΑΜΑΡΟΥΣΙΟΥ| |
|Lead Partner Code|N|*FALSE*| |10001.3454| |
|Area of interest|Y|*FALSE*| |Mobile data, Mobile Voice, IoT, Networking|*List* of 2^nd^ level products|
|Description|N|*FALSE*| |Περιγραφή Αιτήματος: Κάλεσε ο κος Κρινάς και επιθυμεί προσφορά για dia| Additional comments for this Lead|
|First Name|N|*FALSE***| | Κωνσταντίνος| |
|Last Name|N|*TRUE*| |Πασπάτης| |
|Phone |N|*FALSE*| |6987898789| |
|State/Province|N|*FALSE*| |ΑΤΤΙΚΗΣ|Νομός|
|City|N|*FALSE*| |ΖΩΓΡΑΦΟΣ|Περιοχή/Πόλη|
|Street|N|*FALSE*| |ΕΥΡΥΝΟΜΗΣ|Οδός|
|Postal Code|N|*FALSE*| |15771|Ταχυδρομικός Κώδικας|
|External User Id|N|*TRUE*| |[MSIOKLIS@CENTRAL-DOMAIN.ROOT.OTE.GR|mailto:MSIOKLIS@CENTRAL-DOMAIN.ROOT.OTE.GR]|The username of the Siebel user that created the lead.|
|IsConfidential|N|*TRUE*| | |We need to be provided with the logic for the field value.|
|IsConverted|N|*TRUE*| |false|We need to be provided with the logic for the field value. Otherwise we will propagate default: false|
|Lead Status|N|*TRUE*| |Tbt|A default value (Opened)|
|LeadSource|N|*TRUE*| |Shop|A mapping should take place based on the Lead Channel|
|ExternalApplicationId|N|*TRUE*| |myCosmoView|Default value for myCosmoView|

 

Some basic assumptions are 
 * Leads are not stored in our local system. They are stored only in Salesforce.
 * Leads created from CosmoView will not have customer assigned.

Some basic assumptions are

 
 * Leads are not stored in our local system. They are stored only in Salesforce.
 * Leads created from CosmoView will not have customer assigned.
 * When notes are to be implemented , we would like to present them in CosmoView with their related entity

 

Please have in mind that for every “fetch” operation +we want to pass a parameter regarding the aging of the records to fetch+ . For example 2 years

Finally
 * In fetch lead operation, we need to present user the Opportunity friendly identifier ( if is exists , if it converted to opportunity)
 * In fetch event operation , we also need to present the same Opportunity friendly identifier ( if the event is related to Opportunity)

column1: GR Change of Account Ownership through integration - CR
column35:
The creation of Account part is split to US https://jira.dtoneapp.telekom.net/browse/USSFA-3335

 The Account assignment in GR will continue to be maintained in Legacy. As is process: 
 -Some of these accounts are vacant for a long period of time (the account manager is on a leave of absence for a log period of time) and  are assigned to a common user called "COSMOREAD" in legacy .
 -Some accounts always remain  "unassigned"  and are now assigned in legacy in a dummy/generic user "SADMIN"
 The requirement is for SF to "inherit" this info for legacy somehow , both  for unassigned &  vacant accounts , while newly created accounts in SF must be automatically assigned to a generic account owner (account creation / lead conversion)
column316: In case an account is assigned to dummy user in Siebel it should be replicated in SF (either "Cosmoread" or "Sadmin")
column319:
Create dummy user SADMIN without role assigned

Global custom setting extention - add SADMIN / COSMOREAD external ID

Create new checkbox, name "Unaccounted",  if Account Owner external ID = Global Setting Sadmin or COSMOREAD external ID then Unaccounted = TRUE.

A process builder automation is used to set the flag: AccountGROTE.

Sharing rule if Unaccounted= True share with all internal users read/write
column382: 28/May/20 3:23 PM;dennguyen;From original Excel file: Change in th integration GR: When A.M. leaves for e.g. pregnance leave ,the accounts are assigned to “vacant” dummy user in Siebel which doesn’t exist in SFDS.
column383:
23/Sep/20 6:55 PM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c.[~oana.ene]

[~aanagnostopoulos]

[~ipasialis]

The Account assignment in GR will continue to be maintained in Legacy. As is process: 
-Some of these accounts are vacant for a long period of time (the account manager is on a leave of absence for a log period of time) and  are assigned to a common user called "COSMOREAD" in legacy .
-Some accounts always remain  "unassigned"  and are now assigned in legacy in a dummy/generic user "SADMIN"
-Every new account that is created , is automatically assigned to SADMIN as well (either directly or through lead conversion)
The requirement is for SF to "inherit" this info for legacy somehow , both  for unassigned &  vacant accounts , while newly created accounts in SF must be automatically assigned to a generic account owner (account creation / lead conversion)
column384:
24/Sep/20 1:31 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi]

This has big impact on the solution. One user in SF should not own more than 10 000 records [https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.draes.meta/draes/draes_group_membership_data_skew.htm]

Also role hierarchy will not work for those Accounts, we need to discuss who should be able to see/edit them, who will assign a real user instead of the dummy one after Account creation - I strongly advise not to do this "Every new account that is created , is automatically assigned to SADMIN"
column385:
28/Sep/20 10:33 AM;tkiritsi;[~jkomorowska]

c.c [~aanagnostopoulos]

[~ipasialis]

 

The process I described applies to the way things work in our legacy Siebel.

The actual businees need is the following:

In OTE there is no ownership of an Account until the CRM team decides ,based on a set of business criteria (e.g.number of assets , annual revenue, number of employess ,etc)  that an account should become an “accounted” one ,by getting him assigned to a specific Account manager as owner.

That means that the majority of our accounts will never match these sales criteria and become “accounted” accounts , therefore they will never be assigned to a specific account manager as their owner.

Moreover regardless of the fact that an account may be “accounted” or not , everyone must still be able to see all accounts , create leads/opps/etc

All users must be able to distinct these accounted accounts vs non accounted accounts ,in all views e.g. account list , opportunity list , tele appointments outbound functionality etc.

As far as the vacant “accounted” accounts (now assigned in legacy in dummy COSMOREAD user) again all users must be able to see them and know that although they are accounted their owner for the time being is missing

Please provide us your proposal  on how to implement this requirement in SF.
column386:
28/Sep/20 6:22 PM;jkomorowska;[~tkiritsi] please confirm:

1. Every new Account created by other then Integration User should be assigned to SADMIN - The automation to assign automatically a specific user as owner after creation is difficult to create because on each environment it will be a different user ID. Is it possible that legacy CRM will assign this dummy user and return this information to Salesforce?

2. You will have a business process that will assign the Account to "real" owner at some point. Who should be able to change the Account Owner? Only Integration user?

3. you have written "All users must be able to distinct these accounted accounts vs non accounted accounts ,in all views e.g. account list , opportunity list , tele appointments outbound functionality etc." it is a potentially very time consuming activity. On the Account view you will see the Owner, but for changes all other views I would like to ask you for a new user story and define exactly where and what do you want to see. We can add owner to the Account list view, but we cannot easily do the same with opportunity list views. In order to estimate it we need more details, so I will not estimate this part in this User Story

4. All Accounts will be publicly visible except for the confidential ones

5. Can all Accounts owned by SADMIN (except confidential) be also publicly editable?

6. Are Accounts owned by COSMOREAD also publicly editable?

7. Accounts owned by "real" owners are editable only by the owners and Account team

column35:
This is dependent on https://jira.dtoneapp.telekom.net/browse/USSFA-3095
 *  There can not be duplicate of any role within the same Account 

e.g. Contact Marian with role SFA Contact can be created against account OTE and it also can be created against account XYZ

but, another contact with role SFA Contact can not be created against OTE, nor XYZ 
 - So the duplication ignores name, it only matches based on Account Name and role

(it seems this can be delivered using standard duplicate rules)

We must still be able to create new contacts if an old one is turned to inactive. So please take into consideration that this validation should take into account only active contacts 

 

Side effects
 * number of contacts related to account is limited to number of contact roles
 * business user can not create contact role with same role (e.g. two contacts with role Legal, etc.) [this limitation is given by the legacy IT, as confirmed by Ioannis]

column386:
30/Sep/20 9:54 AM;marian.grofcik;Meeting notes after clarification with [~ipasialis] & [~aanagnostopoulos]

- There can not be duplicate within the same Account, not in the whole system 

e.g. Contact Marian with role SFA Contact can be created against account OTE and it also can be created against account XYZ

but, another contact with role SFA Contact can not be created against OTE, nor XYZ 

- So the duplication ignores name, it only matches based on Account Name and role

(it seems this can be delivered using standard duplicate rules)

 

Side effects
 * number of contacts related to account is limited to number of contact roles
 * business user can not create contact role with same role (e.g. two contacts with role Legal, etc.) [this limitation is given by the legacy IT, as confirmed by Ioannis]

 

Probable solution 
 * new custom field Contact Role to be created on Contact (as ACR will not be displayed in GR) 
 * Duplicate & matching rule based on Account Name & Contact Role

column35:
Newly manually created accounts in SF will be also created in Legacy CRM system.
 After Account is created, update from Legacy CRM system will confirm Integration status back into SF.
 Validation for duplicity check will be the same as during convert lead for GR - VAT ID

Example: Coca Cola has vat_id 123456789 and exists in Salesforce. If user tries to create an account with this VAT_ID and error message must be presented and not let him create a duplicate.
column178:
1. Newly manually created accounts in SF are propagated to Legacy CRM systems. Integration status is confirmed after update in Legacy CRM system.
 2. During new account creation duplicity check for VAT ID is triggered for Account.  If user tries to create an account with existing VAT_ID an error message must be presented and not let him create a duplicate.
 3. In case validation shows that Account is already existing, user receives error messages and cannot save the data.

4. Field Status should be auto populated with :never existed value on creation

5. Fieds Industry, Occupation Type, Occupation description should be mandatory to create Account - this req. will be handled under https://jira.dtoneapp.telekom.net/browse/USSFA-4421. If 4421 is not ready by the time this US is done, fields Industry, Occupation Type, Occupation description should be read-only in SF so that correct values can be provided from legacy

column383:
28/Sep/20 9:27 AM;ipasialis;Including [~aanagnostopoulos] , [~tkiritsi] , [~jkomorowska] ,[~oana.ene]

Accounts are mastered in our local central account system - UCM.

Every time an account is being created in Salesforce  ( either by user action in the accounts screen or automatically by converting a lead ) we want the following functionality.
 * Firstly check Salesforce if this VAT_ID already exists and if yes use this account.
 * If this is a new Salesforce VAT_ID , ask UCM if there is available there. If yes , fetch this account from UCM to Salesforce and use it in the process.

Example1 : Coca Cola has vat_id 123456789 and exists in Salesforce. If user tries to create an account with this VAT_ID and error message must be presented and not let him create a duplicate.

Example2 : {color:#172b4d} Coca Cola has vat_id 123456789 and exists in Salesforce. {color}If there is a lead with this VAT_ID and this lead finally converts in account , we want Salesforce to automatically use the Coca Cola account that already exists .   

Example3 : {color:#172b4d} Coca Cola has vat_id 123456789 and does not exist in Salesforce, but exists in UCM.  If a user tries to create an account , Salesforce must search in UCM and fetch this account and present it to the user.{color}

{color:#172b4d}{color:#172b4d}Example4 : {color} Coca Cola has vat_id 123456789 and does not exist in Salesforce, but exists in UCM.  If a lead is about to be converted  , Salesforce must search in UCM and fetch this account and use it in the conversion process instead of creating a new one.{color}

column386:
02/Oct/20 3:54 PM;dmaltezakis;Hi [~mgiannat],

 

You are correct, currently the mapping retrieves only the categories[].id field from the HAL response.

Since the product level categorization is also needed in the front end, I would suggest to propose/mention this to the Salesforce team so that they change the layout and add this new field.

Then, I would suggest you communicate this requirement to the HAL team and ask them if the field categories[].name can support it.

 

In case of positive responses from all of the above, we can change the Interface Agreement and return the name too.

Please notice that in case we finally move forward with adding the categories[].name field in the IA and the response to Salesforce, all NatCos will be affected, since right now we return to Salesforce a field called  "simType" which is an *array of strings*, containing only the values of categories[].id

column35:
*Remote IP Address*: The public IP address of the VPN endpoint (the customer gateway public IP).

*Routing Type*: Static or BGP. If your device supports BGP, please select BGP routing as thats the preferred routing type. 
 * If Static: Provide Static routes (at least one) in CIDR notation.
 * If BGP: Provide Remote ASN.

*Network Device Information*:
 * Device Vendor: Cisco, Check Point...
 * Device Platform (if Cisco was selected): ISR Series, ASR 1000, ASA 5500...
 * Device Software (if ASA 5500 was selected): ASA 9.7 WITH VTI, ASA 9.X WITHOUT VTI...
